summary.long: Psalm is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text:
Happy are those
    who do not follow the advice of the wicked
or take the path that sinners tread
    or sit in the seat of scoffers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but their delight is in the law of the Lord,
    and on his law they meditate day and night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are like trees
    planted by streams of water,
which yield their fruit in its season,
    and their leaves do not wither.
In all that they do, they prosper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked are not so
    but are like chaff that the wind drives away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgment
    nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the Lord watches over the way of the righteous,
    but the way of the wicked will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do the nations conspire
    and the peoples plot in vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of the earth set themselves,
    and the rulers take counsel together,
    against the Lord and his anointed, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Let us burst their bonds apart
    and cast their cords from us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who sits in the heavens laughs;
    the Lord has them in derision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he will speak to them in his wrath
    and terrify them in his fury, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have set my king on Zion, my holy hill.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Ask of me, and I will make the nations your heritage
    and the ends of the earth your possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall break them with a rod of iron
    and dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now therefore, O kings, be wise;
    be warned, O rulers of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Serve the Lord with fear;
with trembling
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
kiss his feet,
or he will be angry, and you will perish in the way,
    for his wrath is quickly kindled.
Happy are all who take refuge in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, how many are my foes!
    Many are rising against me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
many are saying to me,
    “There is no help for you in God.” Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O Lord, are a shield around me,
    my glory, and the one who lifts up my head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cry aloud to the Lord,
    and he answers me from his holy hill. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lie down and sleep;
    I wake again, for the Lord sustains me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am not afraid of ten thousands of people
    who have set themselves against me all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O Lord!
    Deliver me, O my God!
For you strike all my enemies on the cheek;
    you break the teeth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliverance belongs to the Lord;
    may your blessing be on your people! Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer me when I call, O God of my right!
    You gave me room when I was in distress.
    Be gracious to me, and hear my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, you people, shall my honor suffer shame?
    How long will you love vain words and seek after lies? Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But know that the Lord has set apart the faithful for himself;
    the Lord hears when I call to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you are disturbed, do not sin;
    ponder it on your beds, and be silent. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Offer right sacrifices,
    and put your trust in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are many who say, “O that we might see some good!
    Let the light of your face shine on us, O Lord!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have put gladness in my heart
    more than when their grain and wine abound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will both lie down and sleep in peace,
    for you alone, O Lord, make me lie down in safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to my words, O Lord;
    attend to my sighing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to the sound of my cry,
    my King and my God,
    for to you I pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, in the morning you hear my voice;
    in the morning I plead my case to you and watch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you are not a God who delights in wickedness;
    evil will not sojourn with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The boastful will not stand before your eyes;
    you hate all evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You destroy those who speak lies;
    the Lord abhors the bloodthirsty and deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I, through the abundance of your steadfast love,
    will enter your house;
I will bow down toward your holy temple
    in awe of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But let all who take refuge in you rejoice;
    let them ever sing for joy.
Spread your protection over them,
    so that those who love your name may exult in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you bless the righteous, O Lord;
    you cover them with favor as with a shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger
    or discipline me in your wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be gracious to me, O Lord, for I am languishing;
    O Lord, heal me, for my bones are shaking with terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul also is struck with terror,
    while you, O Lord—how long?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn, O Lord, save my life;
    deliver me for the sake of your steadfast love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For in death there is no remembrance of you;
    in Sheol who can give you praise?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes waste away because of grief;
    they grow weak because of all my foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Depart from me, all you workers of evil,
    for the Lord has heard the sound of my weeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has heard my supplication;
    the Lord accepts my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All my enemies shall be ashamed and struck with terror;
    they shall turn back and in a moment be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord my God, in you I take refuge;
    save me from all my pursuers, and deliver me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
or like a lion they will tear me apart;
    they will drag me away, with no one to rescue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord my God, if I have done this,
    if there is wrong in my hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if I have repaid my ally with harm
    or plundered my foe without cause,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then let the enemy pursue and overtake me,
    trample my life to the ground,
    and lay my soul in the dust. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let the assembly of the peoples be gathered around you,
    and over it take your seat on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O let the evil of the wicked come to an end,
    but establish the righteous,
you who test the minds and hearts,
    O righteous God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is my shield,
    who saves the upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is a righteous judge
    and a God who has indignation every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If one does not repent, God will whet his sword;
    he has bent and strung his bow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he has prepared his deadly weapons,
    making his arrows fiery shafts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See how they conceive evil
    and are pregnant with mischief
    and bring forth lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They make a pit, digging it out,
    and fall into the hole that they have made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their mischief returns upon their own heads,
    and on their own heads their violence descends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give to the Lord the thanks due to his righteousness
    and sing praise to the name of the Lord, the Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, our Sovereign,
    how majestic is your name in all the earth!
You have set your glory above the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of the mouths of babes and infants
you have founded a bulwark because of your foes,
    to silence the enemy and the avenger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I look at your heavens, the work of your fingers,
    the moon and the stars that you have established;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
what are humans that you are mindful of them,
    mortals that you care for them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you have made them a little lower than God
    and crowned them with glory and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have given them dominion over the works of your hands;
    you have put all things under their feet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
all sheep and oxen,
    and also the beasts of the field,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the birds of the air, and the fish of the sea,
    whatever passes along the paths of the seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, our Sovereign,
    how majestic is your name in all the earth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks to the Lord with my whole heart;
    I will tell of all your wonderful deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will be glad and exult in you;
    I will sing praise to your name, O Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When my enemies turned back,
    they stumbled and perished before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have maintained my just cause;
    you have sat on the throne giving righteous judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have rebuked the nations; you have destroyed the wicked;
    you have blotted out their name forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord sits enthroned forever;
    he has established his throne for judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He judges the world with righteousness;
    he judges the peoples with equity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is a stronghold for the oppressed,
    a stronghold in times of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And those who know your name put their trust in you,
    for you, O Lord, have not forsaken those who seek you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing praises to the Lord, who dwells in Zion.
    Declare his deeds among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he who avenges blood is mindful of them;
    he does not forget the cry of the afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
so that I may recount all your praises
    and, in the gates of daughter Zion,
    rejoice in your deliverance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nations have sunk in the pit that they made;
    in the net that they hid has their own foot been caught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has made himself known; he has executed judgment;
    the wicked are snared in the work of their own hands. Higgaion. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked shall depart to Sheol,
    all the nations that forget God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the needy shall not always be forgotten,
    nor the hope of the poor perish forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O Lord! Do not let mortals prevail;
    let the nations be judged before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put them in fear, O Lord;
    let the nations know that they are only human. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why, O Lord, do you stand far off?
    Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In arrogance the wicked persecute the poor—
    let them be caught in the schemes they have devised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the wicked boast of the desires of their heart;
    those greedy for gain curse and renounce the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the pride of their countenance the wicked say, “God will not seek it out”;
    all their thoughts are, “There is no God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They think in their heart, “We shall not be moved;
    throughout all generations we shall not meet adversity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their mouths are filled with cursing and deceit and oppression;
    under their tongues are mischief and iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They stoop, they crouch,
    and the helpless fall by their might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They think in their heart, “God has forgotten;
    he has hidden his face; he will never see it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O Lord; O God, lift up your hand;
    do not forget the oppressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do the wicked renounce God
    and say in their hearts, “You will not call us to account”?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Break the arm of the wicked and evildoers;
    seek out their wickedness until you find none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is king forever and ever;
    the nations shall perish from his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, you will hear the desire of the meek;
    you will strengthen their heart; you will incline your ear
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to do justice for the orphan and the oppressed,
    so that those from earth may strike terror no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the Lord I take refuge; how can you say to me,
    “Flee like a bird to the mountains,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
If the foundations are destroyed,
    what can the righteous do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord tests the righteous and the wicked,
    and his soul hates the lover of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the wicked he will rain coals of fire and sulfur;
    a scorching wind shall be the portion of their cup.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Help, O Lord, for there is no longer anyone who is godly;
    the faithful have disappeared from humankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They utter lies to each other;
    with flattering lips and a deceitful heart they speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord cut off all flattering lips,
    the tongue that makes great boasts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
those who say, “With our tongues we will prevail;
    our lips are our own—who is our master?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The promises of the Lord are promises that are pure,
    silver refined in a furnace on the ground,
    purified seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, O Lord, will protect us;
    you will guard us from this generation forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On every side the wicked prowl,
    as vileness is exalted among humankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, O Lord? Will you forget me forever?
    How long will you hide your face from me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long must I bear pain in my soul
    and have sorrow in my heart all day long?
How long shall my enemy be exalted over me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consider and answer me, O Lord my God!
    Give light to my eyes, or I will sleep the sleep of death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and my enemy will say, “I have prevailed”;
    my foes will rejoice because I am shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I trusted in your steadfast love;
    my heart shall rejoice in your salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing to the Lord
    because he has dealt bountifully with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord looks down from heaven on humankind
    to see if there are any who are wise,
    who seek after God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Have they no knowledge, all the evildoers
    who eat up my people as they eat bread
    and do not call upon the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There they shall be in great terror,
    for God is with the company of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You would confound the plans of the poor,
    but the Lord is their refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O that deliverance for Israel would come from Zion!
    When the Lord restores the fortunes of his people,
    Jacob will rejoice; Israel will be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, who may abide in your tent?
    Who may dwell on your holy hill?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who walk blamelessly and do what is right
    and speak the truth from their heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
who do not lend money at interest
    and do not take a bribe against the innocent.
Those who do these things shall never be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Protect me, O God, for in you I take refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I say to the Lord, “You are my Lord;
    I have no good apart from you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for the holy ones in the land, they are the noble ones
    in whom is all my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is my chosen portion and my cup;
    you hold my lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The boundary lines have fallen for me in pleasant places;
    I have a goodly heritage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I bless the Lord, who gives me counsel;
    in the night also my heart instructs me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I keep the Lord always before me;
    because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore my heart is glad, and my soul rejoices;
    my body also rests secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you do not give me up to Sheol
    or let your faithful one see the Pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear a just cause, O Lord; attend to my cry;
    give ear to my prayer from lips free of deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From you let my vindication come;
    let your eyes see the right.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As for what others do, by the word of your lips
    I have avoided the ways of the violent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My steps have held fast to your paths;
    my feet have not slipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call upon you, for you will answer me, O God;
    incline your ear to me; hear my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wondrously show your steadfast love,
    O savior of those who seek refuge
    from their adversaries at your right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Guard me as the apple of the eye;
    hide me in the shadow of your wings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the wicked who despoil me,
    my deadly enemies who surround me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They close their hearts to pity;
    with their mouths they speak arrogantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They flush me out; now they surround me;
    they set their eyes to cast me to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are like a lion eager to tear,
    like a young lion lurking in ambush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O Lord, confront them, overthrow them!
    By your sword deliver my life from the wicked,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I shall behold your face in righteousness;
    when I awake I shall be satisfied, beholding your likeness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I love you, O Lord, my strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is my rock, my fortress, and my deliverer,
    my God, my rock in whom I take refuge,
    my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call upon the Lord, who is worthy to be praised,
    so I shall be saved from my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cords of death encompassed me;
    the torrents of perdition assailed me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the cords of Sheol entangled me;
    the snares of death confronted me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In my distress I called upon the Lord;
    to my God I cried for help.
From his temple he heard my voice,
    and my cry to him reached his ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He bowed the heavens and came down;
    thick darkness was under his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rode on a cherub and flew;
    he came swiftly upon the wings of the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made darkness his covering around him,
    his canopy thick clouds dark with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of the brightness before him
    there broke through his clouds
    hailstones and coals of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord also thundered in the heavens,
    and the Most High uttered his voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he sent out his arrows and scattered them;
    he flashed forth lightnings and routed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the channels of the sea were seen,
    and the foundations of the world were laid bare
at your rebuke, O Lord,
    at the blast of the breath of your nostrils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He reached down from on high; he took me;
    he drew me out of mighty waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He delivered me from my strong enemy
    and from those who hated me,
    for they were too mighty for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They confronted me in the day of my calamity,
    but the Lord was my support.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought me out into a broad place;
    he delivered me because he delighted in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness;
    according to the cleanness of my hands he recompensed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I have kept the ways of the Lord
    and have not wickedly departed from my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all his ordinances were before me,
    and his statutes I did not put away from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was blameless before him,
    and I kept myself from guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the Lord has recompensed me according to my righteousness,
    according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With the loyal you show yourself loyal;
    with the blameless you show yourself blameless;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with the pure you show yourself pure;
    and with the crooked you show yourself shrewd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you deliver a humble people,
    but the haughty eyes you bring down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is you who light my lamp;
    the Lord, my God, lights up my darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By you I can outrun a troop,
    and by my God I can leap over a wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For who is God except the Lord?
    And who is a rock besides our God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The God who has girded me with strength
    and made my way safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made my feet like the feet of a deer
    and set me secure on the heights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He trains my hands for war,
    so that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You gave me a wide place for my steps under me,
    and my feet did not slip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I pursued my enemies and overtook them
    and did not turn back until they were consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I struck them down so that they were unable to rise;
    they fell under my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you girded me with strength for the battle;
    you made my assailants sink under me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You made my enemies turn their backs to me,
    and those who hated me I destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They cried for help, but there was no one to save them;
    they cried to the Lord, but he did not answer them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I beat them fine, like dust before the wind;
    I cast them out like the mire of the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As soon as they heard of me, they obeyed me;
    foreigners came cringing to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Foreigners lost heart
    and came trembling out of their strongholds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord lives! Blessed be my rock,
    and exalted be the God of my salvation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the God who gave me vengeance
    and subdued peoples under me,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For this I will extol you, O Lord, among the nations
    and sing praises to your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great triumphs he gives to his king
    and shows steadfast love to his anointed,
    to David and his descendants forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens are telling the glory of God,
    and the firmament proclaims his handiwork.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Day to day pours forth speech,
    and night to night declares knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no speech, nor are there words;
    their voice is not heard;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
yet their voice goes out through all the earth
    and their words to the end of the world.
In the heavens he has set a tent for the sun,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which comes out like a bridegroom from his wedding canopy,
    and like a strong man runs its course with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Its rising is from the end of the heavens
    and its circuit to the end of them,
    and nothing is hid from its heat.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
the fear of the Lord is pure,
    enduring forever;
the ordinances of the Lord are true
    and righteous altogether.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
More to be desired are they than gold,
    even much fine gold;
sweeter also than honey
    and drippings of the honeycomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover, by them is your servant warned;
    in keeping them there is great reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But who can detect one’s own errors?
    Clear me from hidden faults.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep back your servant also from the insolent;
    do not let them have dominion over me.
Then I shall be blameless
    and innocent of great transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart
    be acceptable to you,
    O Lord, my rock and my redeemer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord answer you in the day of trouble!
    The name of the God of Jacob protect you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he send you help from the sanctuary
    and give you support from Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he remember all your offerings
    and regard with favor your burnt sacrifices. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he grant you your heart’s desire
    and fulfill all your plans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May we shout for joy over your victory
    and in the name of our God set up our banners.
May the Lord fulfill all your petitions.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Some take pride in chariots and some in horses,
    but our pride is in the name of the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will collapse and fall,
    but we shall rise and stand upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give victory to the king, O Lord;
    answer us when we call.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In your strength the king rejoices, O Lord,
    and in your help how greatly he exults!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have given him his heart’s desire
    and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you meet him with rich blessings;
    you set a crown of fine gold on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked you for life; you gave it to him—
    length of days forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His glory is great through your help;
    splendor and majesty you bestow on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You bestow on him blessings forever;
    you make him glad with the joy of your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the king trusts in the Lord,
    and through the steadfast love of the Most High he shall not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your hand will find out all your enemies;
    your right hand will find out those who hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will make them like a fiery furnace
    when you appear.
The Lord will swallow them up in his wrath,
    and fire will consume them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will destroy their offspring from the earth
    and their children from among humankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If they plan evil against you,
    if they devise mischief, they will not succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you will put them to flight;
    you will aim at their faces with your bows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted, O Lord, in your strength!
    We will sing and praise your power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?
    Why are you so far from helping me, from the words of my groaning?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O my God, I cry by day, but you do not answer;
    and by night but find no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you are holy,
    enthroned on the praises of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In you our ancestors trusted;
    they trusted, and you delivered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To you they cried and were saved;
    in you they trusted and were not put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am a worm and not human,
    scorned by others and despised by the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who see me mock me;
    they sneer at me; they shake their heads;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Commit your cause to the Lord; let him deliver—
    let him rescue the one in whom he delights!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet it was you who took me from the womb;
    you kept me safe on my mother’s breast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On you I was cast from my birth,
    and since my mother bore me you have been my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Many bulls encircle me;
    strong bulls of Bashan surround me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they open wide their mouths at me,
    like a ravening and roaring lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I can count all my bones.
They stare and gloat over me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they divide my clothes among themselves,
    and for my clothing they cast lots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O Lord, do not be far away!
    O my help, come quickly to my aid!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver my soul from the sword,
    my life from the power of the dog!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save me from the mouth of the lion!
From the horns of the wild oxen you have rescued me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will tell of your name to my brothers and sisters;
    in the midst of the congregation I will praise you:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For he did not despise or abhor
    the affliction of the afflicted;
he did not hide his face from me
    but heard when I cried to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From you comes my praise in the great congregation;
    my vows I will pay before those who fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All the ends of the earth shall remember
    and turn to the Lord,
and all the families of the nations
    shall worship before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For dominion belongs to the Lord,
    and he rules over the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Posterity will serve him;
    future generations will be told about the Lord
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and proclaim his deliverance to a people yet unborn,
    saying that he has done it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes me lie down in green pastures;
he leads me beside still waters;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he restores my soul.
He leads me in right paths
    for his name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even though I walk through the darkest valley,
    I fear no evil,
for you are with me;
    your rod and your staff,
    they comfort me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me
    all the days of my life,
and I shall dwell in the house of the Lord
    my whole life long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth is the Lord’s and all that is in it,
    the world, and those who live in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he has founded it on the seas
    and established it on the rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who shall ascend the hill of the Lord?
    And who shall stand in his holy place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who have clean hands and pure hearts,
    who do not lift up their souls to what is false
    and do not swear deceitfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will receive blessing from the Lord
    and vindication from the God of their salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Such is the company of those who seek him,
    who seek the face of the God of Jacob. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up your heads, O gates!
    and be lifted up, O ancient doors,
    that the King of glory may come in!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is the King of glory?
    The Lord, strong and mighty,
    the Lord, mighty in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up your heads, O gates!
    and be lifted up, O ancient doors,
    that the King of glory may come in!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is this King of glory?
    The Lord of hosts,
    he is the King of glory. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To you, O Lord, I lift up my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let those who wait for you be put to shame;
    let them be ashamed who are wantonly treacherous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make me to know your ways, O Lord;
    teach me your paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Be mindful of your mercy, O Lord, and of your steadfast love,
    for they have been from of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Good and upright is the Lord;
    therefore he instructs sinners in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He leads the humble in what is right
    and teaches the humble his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the paths of the Lord are steadfast love and faithfulness,
    for those who keep his covenant and his decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For your name’s sake, O Lord,
    pardon my guilt, for it is great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who are they who fear the Lord?
    He will teach them the way that they should choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will abide in prosperity,
    and their children shall possess the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The friendship of the Lord is for those who fear him,
    and he makes his covenant known to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes are ever toward the Lord,
    for he will pluck my feet out of the net.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn to me and be gracious to me,
    for I am lonely and afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Relieve the troubles of my heart,
    and bring me out of my distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consider my affliction and my trouble,
    and forgive all my sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consider how many are my foes
    and with what violent hatred they hate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O guard my life and deliver me;
    do not let me be put to shame, for I take refuge in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May integrity and uprightness preserve me,
    for I wait for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Redeem Israel, O God,
    out of all its troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Prove me, O Lord, and try me;
    test my heart and mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For your steadfast love is before my eyes,
    and I walk in faithfulness to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I do not sit with the worthless,
    nor do I consort with hypocrites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate the company of evildoers
    and will not sit with the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I wash my hands in innocence
    and go around your altar, O Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
singing aloud a song of thanksgiving
    and telling all your wondrous deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, I love the house in which you dwell
    and the place where your glory abides.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not sweep me away with sinners
    nor my life with the bloodthirsty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
those in whose hands are evil devices
    and whose right hands are full of bribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, I walk in my integrity;
    redeem me and be gracious to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My foot stands on level ground;
    in the great congregation I will bless the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When evildoers assail me
    to devour my flesh—
my adversaries and foes—
    they shall stumble and fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though an army encamp against me,
    my heart shall not fear;
though war rise up against me,
    yet I will be confident.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One thing I asked of the Lord;
    this I seek:
to live in the house of the Lord
    all the days of my life,
to behold the beauty of the Lord,
    and to inquire in his temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Now my head is lifted up
    above my enemies all around me,
and I will offer in his tent
    sacrifices with shouts of joy;
I will sing and make melody to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O Lord, when I cry aloud;
    be gracious to me and answer me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Come,” my heart says, “seek his face!”
    Your face, Lord, do I seek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not hide your face from me.
Do not turn your servant away in anger,
    you who have been my help.
Do not cast me off; do not forsake me,
    O God of my salvation!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If my father and mother forsake me,
    the Lord will take me up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me your way, O Lord,
    and lead me on a level path
    because of my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I believe that I shall see the goodness of the Lord
    in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear the voice of my supplication,
    as I cry to you for help,
as I lift up my hands
    toward your most holy sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not drag me away with the wicked,
    with those who are workers of evil,
who speak peace with their neighbors
    while mischief is in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Because they do not regard the works of the Lord
    or the work of his hands,
he will break them down and build them up no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord,
    for he has heard the sound of my pleadings.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is the strength of his people;
    he is the saving refuge of his anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O save your people and bless your heritage;
    be their shepherd and carry them forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord, O heavenly beings,
    ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord the glory of his name;
    worship the Lord in holy splendor.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the Lord is powerful;
    the voice of the Lord is full of majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars;
    the Lord breaks the cedars of Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes Lebanon skip like a calf
    and Sirion like a young wild ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The voice of the Lord flashes forth flames of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the Lord shakes the wilderness;
    the Lord shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the Lord causes the oaks to whirl
    and strips the forest bare,
    and in his temple all say, “Glory!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord sits enthroned over the flood;
    the Lord sits enthroned as king forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord give strength to his people!
    May the Lord bless his people with peace!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will extol you, O Lord, for you have drawn me up
    and did not let my foes rejoice over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord my God, I cried to you for help,
    and you have healed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, you brought up my soul from Sheol,
    restored me to life from among those gone down to the Pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing praises to the Lord, O you his faithful ones,
    and give thanks to his holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For his anger is but for a moment;
    his favor is for a lifetime.
Weeping may linger for the night,
    but joy comes with the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I said in my prosperity,
    “I shall never be moved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
To you, O Lord, I cried,
    and to the Lord I made supplication:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What profit is there in my death,
    if I go down to the Pit?
Will the dust praise you?
    Will it tell of your faithfulness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O Lord, and be gracious to me!
    O Lord, be my helper!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
so that my soul may praise you and not be silent.
    O Lord my God, I will give thanks to you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Incline your ear to me;
    rescue me speedily.
Be a rock of refuge for me,
    a strong fortress to save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are indeed my rock and my fortress;
    for your name’s sake lead me and guide me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
take me out of the net that is hidden for me,
    for you are my refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Into your hand I commit my spirit;
    you have redeemed me, O Lord, faithful God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You hate those who pay regard to worthless idols,
    but I trust in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
and have not delivered me into the hand of the enemy;
    you have set my feet in a broad place.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For my life is spent with sorrow
    and my years with sighing;
my strength fails because of my misery,
    and my bones waste away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am the scorn of all my adversaries,
    a horror to my neighbors,
an object of dread to my acquaintances;
    those who see me in the street flee from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have passed out of mind like one who is dead;
    I have become like a broken vessel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I hear the whispering of many—
    terror all around!—
as they scheme together against me,
    as they plot to take my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I trust in you, O Lord;
    I say, “You are my God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My times are in your hand;
    deliver me from the hand of my enemies and persecutors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your face shine upon your servant;
    save me in your steadfast love.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let the lying lips be stilled
    that speak insolently against the righteous
    with pride and contempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O how abundant is your goodness
    that you have laid up for those who fear you
and accomplished for those who take refuge in you,
    in the sight of everyone!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the shelter of your presence you hide them
    from human plots;
you hold them safe under your shelter
    from contentious tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord,
    for he has wondrously shown his steadfast love to me
    when I was beset as a city under siege.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I had said in my alarm,
    “I am driven far from your sight.”
But you heard my supplications
    when I cried out to you for help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Love the Lord, all you his saints.
    The Lord preserves the faithful
    but abundantly repays the one who acts haughtily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be strong, and let your heart take courage,
    all you who wait for the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are those whose transgression is forgiven,
    whose sin is covered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are those to whom the Lord imputes no iniquity
    and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
While I kept silent, my body wasted away
    through my groaning all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For day and night your hand was heavy upon me;
    my strength was dried up as by the heat of summer. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I acknowledged my sin to you,
    and I did not hide my iniquity;
I said, “I will confess my transgressions to the Lord,”
    and you forgave the guilt of my sin. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore let all who are faithful
    offer prayer to you;
at a time of distress, the rush of mighty waters
    shall not reach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will instruct you and teach you the way you should go;
    I will counsel you with my eye upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be like a horse or a mule, without understanding,
    whose temper must be curbed with bit and bridle,
    else it will not stay near you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are the torments of the wicked,
    but steadfast love surrounds those who trust in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be glad in the Lord and rejoice, O righteous,
    and shout for joy, all you upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice in the Lord, O you righteous.
    Praise befits the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord with the lyre;
    make melody to him with the harp of ten strings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to him a new song;
    play skillfully on the strings, with loud shouts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the word of the Lord is upright,
    and all his work is done in faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He loves righteousness and justice;
    the earth is full of the steadfast love of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the word of the Lord the heavens were made
    and all their host by the breath of his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gathered the waters of the sea as in a bottle;
    he put the deeps in storehouses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let all the earth fear the Lord;
    let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he spoke, and it came to be;
    he commanded, and it stood firm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord brings the counsel of the nations to nothing;
    he frustrates the plans of the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The counsel of the Lord stands forever,
    the thoughts of his heart to all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy is the nation whose God is the Lord,
    the people whom he has chosen as his heritage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord looks down from heaven;
    he sees all humankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From where he sits enthroned he watches
    all the inhabitants of the earth—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he who fashions the hearts of them all
    and observes all their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A king is not saved by his great army;
    a warrior is not delivered by his great strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The war horse is a vain hope for victory,
    and by its great might it cannot save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly the eye of the Lord is on those who fear him,
    on those who hope in his steadfast love,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to deliver their soul from death
    and to keep them alive in famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our soul waits for the Lord;
    he is our help and shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our heart is glad in him
    because we trust in his holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your steadfast love, O Lord, be upon us,
    even as we hope in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bless the Lord at all times;
    his praise shall continually be in my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul makes its boast in the Lord;
    let the humble hear and be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O magnify the Lord with me,
    and let us exalt his name together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I sought the Lord, and he answered me
    and delivered me from all my fears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look to him, and be radiant,
    so your faces shall never be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This poor soul cried and was heard by the Lord
    and was saved from every trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The angel of the Lord encamps
    around those who fear him and delivers them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O taste and see that the Lord is good;
    happy are those who take refuge in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O fear the Lord, you his holy ones,
    for those who fear him have no want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The young lions suffer want and hunger,
    but those who seek the Lord lack no good thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, O children, listen to me;
    I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Which of you desires life
    and covets many days to enjoy good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep your tongue from evil
    and your lips from speaking deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Depart from evil, and do good;
    seek peace, and pursue it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord are on the righteous,
    and his ears are open to their cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The face of the Lord is against evildoers,
    to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the righteous cry for help, the Lord hears
    and rescues them from all their troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is near to the brokenhearted
    and saves the crushed in spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are the afflictions of the righteous,
    but the Lord rescues them from them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He keeps all their bones;
    not one of them will be broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evil brings death to the wicked,
    and those who hate the righteous will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord redeems the life of his servants;
    none of those who take refuge in him will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Contend, O Lord, with those who contend with me;
    fight against those who fight against me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take hold of shield and buckler,
    and rise up to help me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Draw the spear and javelin
    against my pursuers;
say to my soul,
    “I am your salvation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be put to shame and dishonor
    who seek after my life.
Let them be turned back and confounded
    who devise evil against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be like chaff before the wind,
    with the angel of the Lord driving them on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let their way be dark and slippery,
    with the angel of the Lord pursuing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For without cause they hid their net for me;
    without cause they dug a pit for my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then my soul shall rejoice in the Lord,
    exulting in his deliverance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All my bones shall say,
    “O Lord, who is like you?
You deliver the weak
    from those too strong for them,
    the weak and needy from those who despoil them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Malicious witnesses rise up;
    they ask me about things I do not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They repay me evil for good;
    my soul is forlorn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, when they were sick,
    I wore sackcloth;
    I afflicted myself with fasting.
I prayed with head bowed on my bosom,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
they impiously mocked more and more,
    gnashing at me with their teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, O Lord, will you look on?
    Rescue me from their ravages,
    my life from the lions!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will thank you in the great congregation;
    in the mighty throng I will praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let my treacherous enemies rejoice over me
    or those who hate me without cause wink the eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they do not speak peace,
    but they conceive deceitful words
    against those who are quiet in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You have seen, O Lord; do not be silent!
    O Lord, do not be far from me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wake up! Rouse yourself for my defense,
    for my cause, my God and my Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Vindicate me, O Lord, my God,
    according to your righteousness,
    and do not let them rejoice over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let them say to themselves,
    “Aha, we have our heart’s desire.”
Do not let them say, “We have swallowed you up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let all those who rejoice at my calamity
    be put to shame and confusion;
let those who exalt themselves against me
    be clothed with shame and dishonor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those who desire my vindication
    shout for joy and be glad
    and say evermore,
“Great is the Lord,
    who delights in the welfare of his servant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then my tongue shall tell of your righteousness
    and of your praise all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Transgression speaks to the wicked
    deep in their hearts;
there is no fear of God
    before their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they flatter themselves in their own eyes
    that their iniquity cannot be found out and hated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of their mouths are mischief and deceit;
    they have ceased to act wisely and do good.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your steadfast love, O Lord, extends to the heavens,
    your faithfulness to the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How precious is your steadfast love, O God!
    All people may take refuge in the shadow of your wings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They feast on the abundance of your house,
    and you give them drink from the river of your delights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For with you is the fountain of life;
    in your light we see light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O continue your steadfast love to those who know you
    and your salvation to the upright of heart!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let the foot of the arrogant tread on me
    or the hand of the wicked drive me away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There the evildoers lie prostrate;
    they are thrust down, unable to rise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not fret because of the wicked;
    do not be envious of wrongdoers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for they will soon fade like the grass
    and wither like the green herb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trust in the Lord and do good;
    live in the land and enjoy security.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take delight in the Lord,
    and he will give you the desires of your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Commit your way to the Lord;
    trust in him, and he will act.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will make your vindication shine like the light
    and the justice of your cause like the noonday.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Refrain from anger and forsake wrath.
    Do not fret—it leads only to evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the wicked shall be cut off,
    but those who wait for the Lord shall inherit the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet a little while, and the wicked will be no more;
    though you look diligently for their place, they will not be there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the meek shall inherit the land
    and delight themselves in abundant prosperity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked plot against the righteous
    and gnash their teeth at them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but the Lord laughs at the wicked,
    for he sees that their day is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
their sword shall enter their own heart,
    and their bows shall be broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a little that the righteous person has
    than the abundance of many wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the arms of the wicked shall be broken,
    but the Lord upholds the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord knows the days of the blameless,
    and their heritage will abide forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they are not put to shame in evil times;
    in the days of famine they have abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked borrow and do not pay back,
    but the righteous are generous and keep giving;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
surely those blessed by the Lord shall inherit the land,
    but those cursed by him shall be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our steps are made firm by the Lord
    when he delights in our way;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though we stumble, we shall not fall headlong,
    for the Lord holds us by the hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have been young and now am old,
    yet I have not seen the righteous forsaken
    or their children begging bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are ever giving liberally and lending,
    and their children become a blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Depart from evil, and do good;
    so you shall abide forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord loves justice;
    he will not forsake his faithful ones.
The righteous shall be kept safe forever,
    but the children of the wicked shall be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous shall inherit the land
    and live in it forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouths of the righteous utter wisdom,
    and their tongues speak justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The law of their God is in their hearts;
    their steps do not slip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked watch for the righteous
    and seek to kill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will not abandon them to their power
    or let them be condemned when they are brought to trial.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen the wicked oppressing
    and towering like a cedar of Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Again I passed by, and they were no more;
    though I sought them, they could not be found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mark the blameless and behold the upright,
    for there is posterity for the peaceable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But transgressors shall be altogether destroyed;
    the posterity of the wicked shall be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The salvation of the righteous is from the Lord;
    he is their refuge in the time of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger
    or discipline me in your wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For your arrows have sunk into me,
    and your hand has come down on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no soundness in my flesh
    because of your indignation;
there is no health in my bones
    because of my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my iniquities have gone over my head;
    they weigh like a burden too heavy for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My wounds grow foul and fester
    because of my foolishness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am utterly bowed down and prostrate;
    all day long I go around mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my loins are filled with burning,
    and there is no soundness in my flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am utterly spent and crushed;
    I groan because of the tumult of my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, all my longing is known to you;
    my sighing is not hidden from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart throbs; my strength fails me;
    as for the light of my eyes—it also has gone from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My friends and companions stand aloof from my affliction,
    and my neighbors stand far off.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But I am like the deaf; I do not hear;
    like the mute, who cannot speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly, I am like one who does not hear
    and in whose mouth is no retort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But it is for you, O Lord, that I wait;
    it is you, O Lord my God, who will answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I pray, “Only do not let them rejoice over me,
    those who boast against me when my foot slips.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I am ready to fall,
    and my pain is ever with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I confess my iniquity;
    I am sorry for my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who are my foes without cause are mighty,
    and many are those who hate me wrongfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who render me evil for good
    are my adversaries because I follow after good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not forsake me, O Lord;
    O my God, do not be far from me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
make haste to help me,
    O Lord, my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, “I will guard my ways
    that I may not sin with my tongue;
I will keep a muzzle on my mouth
    as long as the wicked are in my presence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You have made my days a few handbreadths,
    and my lifetime is as nothing in your sight.
Surely everyone stands as a mere breath. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“And now, O Lord, what do I wait for?
    My hope is in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from all my transgressions.
    Do not make me the scorn of the fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am silent; I do not open my mouth,
    for it is you who have done it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remove your stroke from me;
    I am worn down by the blows of your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You chastise mortals
    in punishment for sin,
consuming like a moth what is dear to them;
    surely everyone is a mere breath. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear my prayer, O Lord,
    and give ear to my cry;
    do not hold your peace at my tears.
For I am your passing guest,
    an alien, like all my forebears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn your gaze away from me, that I may smile again,
    before I depart and am no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I waited patiently for the Lord;
    he inclined to me and heard my cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He drew me up from the desolate pit,
    out of the miry bog,
and set my feet upon a rock,
    making my steps secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He put a new song in my mouth,
    a song of praise to our God.
Many will see and fear
    and put their trust in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are those who make
    the Lord their trust,
who do not turn to the proud,
    to those who go astray after false gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have multiplied, O Lord my God,
    your wondrous deeds and your thoughts toward us;
    none can compare with you.
Were I to proclaim and tell of them,
    they would be more than can be counted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sacrifice and offering you do not desire,
    but you have given me an open ear.
Burnt offering and sin offering
    you have not required.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, “Here I am;
    in the scroll of the book it is written of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I delight to do your will, O my God;
    your law is within my heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have told the glad news of deliverance
    in the great congregation;
see, I have not restrained my lips,
    as you know, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not, O Lord, withhold
    your mercy from me;
let your steadfast love and your faithfulness
    keep me safe forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me;
    O Lord, make haste to help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let all those be put to shame and confusion
    who seek to snatch away my life;
let those be turned back and brought to dishonor
    who desire my hurt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those be appalled because of their shame
    who say to me, “Aha, Aha!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But may all who seek you
    rejoice and be glad in you;
may those who love your salvation
    say continually, “Great is the Lord!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I am poor and needy,
    but the Lord takes thought for me.
You are my help and my deliverer;
    do not delay, O my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are those who consider the poor;
    the Lord delivers them in the day of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord sustains them on their sickbed;
    in their illness you heal all their infirmities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I said, “O Lord, be gracious to me;
    heal me, for I have sinned against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My enemies wonder in malice
    when I will die and my name perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All who hate me whisper together about me;
    they imagine the worst for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They think that a deadly thing has fastened on me,
    that I will not rise again from where I lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even my close friend in whom I trusted,
    who ate of my bread, has lifted the heel against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O Lord, be gracious to me,
    and raise me up, that I may repay them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By this I know that you are pleased with me:
    because my enemy has not triumphed over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you have upheld me because of my integrity
    and set me in your presence forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
    from everlasting to everlasting.
                Amen and Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a deer longs for flowing streams,
    so my soul longs for you, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul thirsts for God,
    for the living God.
When shall I come and behold
    the face of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My tears have been my food
    day and night,
while people say to me continually,
    “Where is your God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These things I remember,
    as I pour out my soul:
how I went with the throng
    and led them in procession to the house of God,
with glad shouts and songs of thanksgiving,
    a multitude keeping festival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are you cast down, O my soul,
    and why are you disquieted within me?
Hope in God, for I shall again praise him,
my help
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Deep calls to deep
    at the thunder of your torrents;
all your waves and your billows
    have gone over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By day the Lord commands his steadfast love,
    and at night his song is with me,
    a prayer to the God of my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I say to God, my rock,
    “Why have you forgotten me?
Why must I walk about mournfully
    because the enemy oppresses me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As with a deadly wound in my body,
    my adversaries taunt me,
while they say to me continually,
    “Where is your God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are you cast down, O my soul,
    and why are you disquieted within me?
Hope in God, for I shall again praise him,
    my help and my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For you are the God in whom I take refuge;
    why have you cast me off?
Why must I walk about mournfully
    because of the oppression of the enemy?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will go to the altar of God,
    to God my exceeding joy,
and I will praise you with the harp,
    O God, my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are you cast down, O my soul,
    and why are you disquieted within me?
Hope in God, for I shall again praise him,
    my help and my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have heard with our ears, O God;
    our ancestors have told us
what deeds you performed in their days,
    in the days of old:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
for not by their own sword did they win the land,
    nor did their own arm give them victory,
but your right hand, and your arm,
    and the light of your countenance,
    for you delighted in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are my King and my God;
    you command victories for Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through you we push down our foes;
    through your name we tread down our assailants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For not in my bow do I trust,
    nor can my sword save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you have saved us from our foes
    and have put to confusion those who hate us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God we have boasted continually,
    and we will give thanks to your name forever. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you have rejected us and shamed us
    and have not gone out with our armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You made us turn back from the foe,
    and our enemies have gotten spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us like sheep for slaughter
    and have scattered us among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have sold your people for a trifle,
    demanding no high price for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us the taunt of our neighbors,
    the derision and scorn of those around us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us a byword among the nations,
    a laughingstock among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long my disgrace is before me,
    and shame has covered my face
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
at the words of the taunters and revilers,
    at the sight of the enemy and the avenger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All this has come upon us,
    yet we have not forgotten you
    or been false to your covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our heart has not turned back,
    nor have our steps departed from your way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
yet you have broken us in the haunt of jackals
    and covered us with deep darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If we had forgotten the name of our God
    or spread out our hands to a strange god,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
would not God discover this?
    For he knows the secrets of the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of you we are being killed all day long
    and accounted as sheep for the slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rouse yourself! Why do you sleep, O Lord?
    Awake, do not cast us off forever!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you hide your face?
    Why do you forget our affliction and oppression?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For we sink down to the dust;
    our bodies cling to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, come to our help.
    Redeem us for the sake of your steadfast love.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Gird your sword on your thigh, O mighty one,
    in your glory and majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your throne, O God, endures forever and ever.
    Your royal scepter is a scepter of equity;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
your robes are all fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia.
From ivory palaces stringed instruments make you glad;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
daughters of kings are among your ladies of honor;
    at your right hand stands the queen in gold of Ophir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O daughter, consider and incline your ear;
    forget your people and your father’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and the king will desire your beauty.
Since he is your lord, bow to him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Daughter Tyre will seek your favor with gifts,
the richest of the people
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with all kinds of wealth.
The princess is decked in her chamber with gold-woven robes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in many-colored robes she is led to the king;
    behind her the virgins, her companions, follow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With joy and gladness they are led along
    as they enter the palace of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the place of ancestors you, O king, shall have sons;
    you will make them princes in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will cause your name to be celebrated in all generations;
    therefore the peoples will praise you forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is our refuge and strength,
    a very present help in trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore we will not fear, though the earth should change,
    though the mountains shake in the heart of the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though its waters roar and foam,
    though the mountains tremble with its tumult. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God,
    the holy habitation of the Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is in the midst of the city; it shall not be moved;
    God will help it when the morning dawns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nations are in an uproar; the kingdoms totter;
    he utters his voice; the earth melts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of hosts is with us;
    the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, behold the works of the Lord;
    see what desolations he has brought on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of hosts is with us;
    the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Clap your hands, all you peoples;
    shout to God with loud songs of joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord, the Most High, is awesome,
    a great king over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He subdued peoples under us
    and nations under our feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He chose our heritage for us,
    the pride of Jacob whom he loves. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has gone up with a shout,
    the Lord with the sound of a trumpet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing praises to God, sing praises;
    sing praises to our King, sing praises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God is the king of all the earth;
    sing praises with a psalm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is king over the nations;
    God sits on his holy throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The princes of the peoples gather
    as the people of the God of Abraham.
For the shields of the earth belong to God;
    he is highly exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
