Great is the Lord and greatly to be praised
    in the city of our God.
His holy mountain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
beautiful in elevation,
    is the joy of all the earth,
Mount Zion, in the far north,
    the city of the great King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Within its citadels God
    has shown himself a sure defense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the kings assembled;
    they came on together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As soon as they saw it, they were astounded;
    they were in panic; they took to flight;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
trembling took hold of them there,
    pains as of a woman in labor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
as when an east wind shatters
    the ships of Tarshish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As we have heard, so have we seen
    in the city of the Lord of hosts,
in the city of our God,
    which God establishes forever. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We ponder your steadfast love, O God,
    in the midst of your temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your name, O God, like your praise,
    reaches to the ends of the earth.
Your right hand is filled with victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Walk about Zion; go all around it;
    count its towers;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
that this is God,
our God forever and ever.
    He will be our guide forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear this, all you peoples;
    give ear, all inhabitants of the world,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
both low and high,
    rich and poor together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth shall speak wisdom;
    the meditation of my heart shall be understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will incline my ear to a proverb;
    I will solve my riddle to the music of the harp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should I fear in times of trouble,
    when the iniquity of my persecutors surrounds me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
those who trust in their wealth
    and boast of the abundance of their riches?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly, no ransom avails for one’s life;
    there is no price one can give to God for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the ransom of life is costly
    and can never suffice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that one should live on forever
    and never see the Pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Their graves are their homes forever,
    their dwelling places to all generations,
    though they named lands their own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mortals cannot abide in their pomp;
    they are like the animals that perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Such is the fate of the foolhardy,
    the end of those who are pleased with their lot. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But God will ransom my soul from the power of Sheol,
    for he will receive me. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be afraid when some become rich,
    when the wealth of their houses increases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For when they die they will carry nothing away;
    their wealth will not go down after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though in their lifetime they count themselves happy
    —for you are praised when you do well for yourself—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they will go to the company of their ancestors,
    who will never again see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mortals cannot abide in their pomp;
    they are like the animals that perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mighty one, God the Lord,
    speaks and summons the earth
    from the rising of the sun to its setting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty,
    God shines forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He calls to the heavens above
    and to the earth, that he may judge his people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Gather to me my faithful ones,
    who made a covenant with me by sacrifice!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens declare his righteousness,
    for God himself is judge. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear, O my people, and I will speak,
    O Israel, I will testify against you.
    I am God, your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Not for your sacrifices do I rebuke you;
    your burnt offerings are continually before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not accept a bull from your house
    or goats from your folds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For every wild animal of the forest is mine,
    the cattle on a thousand hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know all the birds of the air,
    and all that moves in the field is mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If I were hungry, I would not tell you,
    for the world and all that is in it is mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do I eat the flesh of bulls
    or drink the blood of goats?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving,
    and pay your vows to the Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Call on me in the day of trouble;
    I will deliver you, and you shall glorify me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But to the wicked God says,
    “What right have you to recite my statutes
    or take my covenant on your lips?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you hate discipline,
    and you cast my words behind you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You make friends with a thief when you see one,
    and you keep company with adulterers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You give your mouth free rein for evil,
    and your tongue frames deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You sit and speak against your kin;
    you slander your own mother’s child.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Mark this, then, you who forget God,
    or I will tear you apart, and there will be no one to deliver.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Have mercy on me, O God,
    according to your steadfast love;
according to your abundant mercy,
    blot out my transgressions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity,
    and cleanse me from my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I know my transgressions,
    and my sin is ever before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against you, you alone, have I sinned
    and done what is evil in your sight,
so that you are justified in your sentence
    and blameless when you pass judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, I was born guilty,
    a sinner when my mother conceived me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You desire truth in the inward being;
    therefore teach me wisdom in my secret heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean;
    wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me hear joy and gladness;
    let the bones that you have crushed rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide your face from my sins,
    and blot out all my iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Create in me a clean heart, O God,
    and put a new and right spirit within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not cast me away from your presence,
    and do not take your holy spirit from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore to me the joy of your salvation,
    and sustain in me a willing spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will teach transgressors your ways,
    and sinners will return to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from bloodshed, O God,
    O God of my salvation,
    and my tongue will sing aloud of your deliverance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, open my lips,
    and my mouth will declare your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have no delight in sacrifice;
    if I were to give a burnt offering, you would not be pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sacrifice acceptable to God is a broken spirit;
    a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do good to Zion in your good pleasure;
    rebuild the walls of Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you boast, O mighty one,
    of mischief done against the godly?
All day long
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you are plotting destruction.
Your tongue is like a sharp razor,
    you worker of treachery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You love evil more than good
    and lying more than speaking the truth. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You love all words that devour,
    O deceitful tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will see and fear
    and will laugh at the evildoer, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“See the one who would not take
    refuge in God
but trusted in abundant riches
    and sought refuge in wealth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am like a green olive tree
    in the house of God.
I trust in the steadfast love of God
    forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will thank you forever
    because of what you have done.
In the presence of the faithful
    I will proclaim your name, for it is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God looks down from heaven on humankind
    to see if there are any who are wise,
    who seek after God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Have they no knowledge, those evildoers,
    who eat up my people as they eat bread
    and do not call upon God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There they shall be in great terror,
    in terror such as has not been.
For God will scatter the bones of the ungodly;
    they will be put to shame, for God has rejected them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O that deliverance for Israel would come from Zion!
    When God restores the fortunes of his people,
    Jacob will rejoice; Israel will be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save me, O God, by your name,
    and vindicate me by your might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my prayer, O God;
    give ear to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But surely, God is my helper;
    the Lord is the upholder of my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will repay my enemies for their evil.
    In your faithfulness, put an end to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With a freewill offering I will sacrifice to you;
    I will give thanks to your name, O Lord, for it is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he has delivered me from every trouble,
    and my eye has looked in triumph on my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear to my prayer, O God;
    do not hide yourself from my supplication.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
by the noise of the enemy,
    because of the clamor of the wicked.
For they bring trouble upon me,
    and in anger they bear a grudge against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is in anguish within me;
    the terrors of death have fallen upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fear and trembling come upon me,
    and horror overwhelms me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I say, “O that I had wings like a dove!
    I would fly away and be at rest;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
truly, I would flee far away;
    I would lodge in the wilderness; Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would hurry to find a shelter for myself
    from the raging wind and tempest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Confuse, O Lord, confound their speech,
    for I see violence and strife in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
It is not enemies who taunt me—
    I could bear that;
it is not adversaries who deal insolently with me—
    I could hide from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But it is you, my equal,
    my companion, my familiar friend,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with whom I kept pleasant company;
    we walked in the house of God with the throng.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But I call upon God,
    and the Lord will save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evening and morning and at noon
    I utter my complaint and moan,
    and he will hear my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God, who is enthroned from of old, Selah
    will hear and will humble them,
because they do not change
    and do not fear God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My companion laid hands on a friend
    and violated a covenant with me
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with speech smoother than butter
    but with a heart set on war,
with words that were softer than oil
    but in fact were drawn swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cast your burden on the Lord,
    and he will sustain you;
he will never permit
    the righteous to be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O God, will cast them down
    into the lowest pit;
the bloodthirsty and treacherous
    shall not live out half their days.
But I will trust in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be gracious to me, O God, for people trample on me;
    all day long foes oppress me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my enemies trample on me all day long,
    for many fight against me.
O Most High,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when I am afraid,
    I put my trust in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All day long they seek to injure my cause;
    all their thoughts are against me for evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not deliver them for any reason;
    in wrath cast down the peoples, O God!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then my enemies will retreat
    in the day when I call.
    This I know, that God is for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God, whose word I praise,
    in the Lord, whose word I praise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in God I trust; I am not afraid.
    What can a mere mortal do to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My vows to you I must perform, O God;
    I will render thank offerings to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have delivered my soul from death
    and my feet from falling,
so that I may walk before God
    in the light of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be merciful to me, O God; be merciful to me,
    for in you my soul takes refuge;
in the shadow of your wings I will take refuge,
    until the destroying storms pass by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cry to God Most High,
    to God who fulfills his purpose for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I lie down among lions
    that greedily devour human prey;
their teeth are spears and arrows,
    their tongues sharp swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens.
    Let your glory be over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They set a net for my steps;
    my soul was bowed down.
They dug a pit in my path,
    but they have fallen into it themselves. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, my soul!
Awake, O harp and lyre!
    I will awake the dawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks to you, O Lord, among the peoples;
    I will sing praises to you among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For your steadfast love is as high as the heavens;
    your faithfulness extends to the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens.
    Let your glory be over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you indeed decree what is right, you gods?
    Do you judge people fairly?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No, in your hearts you devise wrongs;
    your hands deal out violence on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked go astray from the womb;
    they err from their birth, speaking lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have venom like the venom of a serpent,
    like the deaf adder that stops its ear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that it does not hear the voice of charmers
    or of the cunning enchanter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, break the teeth in their mouths;
    tear out the fangs of the young lions, O Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them vanish like water that runs away;
    like grass let them be trodden down and wither.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be like the snail that dissolves into slime,
    like the untimely birth that never sees the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sooner than your pots can feel the heat of thorns,
    whether green or ablaze, may he sweep them away!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will rejoice when they see vengeance done;
    they will bathe their feet in the blood of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People will say, “Surely there is a reward for the righteous;
    surely there is a God who judges on earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from my enemies, O my God;
    protect me from those who rise up against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from those who work evil;
    from the bloodthirsty, save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
for no fault of mine, they run and make ready.
Rouse yourself, come to my help and see!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Each evening they come back
    howling like dogs
    and prowling about the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There they are, bellowing with their mouths,
    with sharp words on their lips,
    for “Who,” they think, “will hear us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you laugh at them, O Lord;
    you hold all the nations in derision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O my strength, I will watch for you,
    for you, O God, are my fortress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My God in his steadfast love will meet me;
    my God will let me look in triumph on my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the sin of their mouths, the words of their lips,
    let them be trapped in their pride.
For the cursing and lies that they utter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
consume them in wrath;
    consume them until they are no more.
Then it will be known to the ends of the earth
    that God rules over Jacob. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Each evening they come back
    howling like dogs
    and prowling about the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They roam about for food
    and growl if they do not get their fill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I will sing of your might;
    I will sing aloud of your steadfast love in the morning.
For you have been a fortress for me
    and a refuge in the day of my distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O God, you have rejected us, broken our defenses;
    you have been angry; now restore us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have caused the land to quake; you have torn it open;
    repair the cracks in it, for it is tottering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made your people suffer hard things;
    you have given us wine to drink that made us reel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have set up a banner for those who fear you,
    to rally to it out of bowshot. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give victory with your right hand and answer us,
    so that those whom you love may be rescued.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has promised in his sanctuary,
    “With exultation I will divide up Shechem
    and portion out the Vale of Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who will bring me to the fortified city?
    Who will lead me to Edom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not rejected us, O God?
    You do not go out, O God, with our armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O grant us help against the foe,
    for human help is worthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With God we shall do valiantly;
    it is he who will tread down our foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my cry, O God;
    listen to my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the end of the earth I call to you,
    when my heart is faint.
Lead me to the rock
    that is higher than I,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for you are my refuge,
    a strong tower against the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me abide in your tent forever,
    find refuge under the shelter of your wings. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you, O God, have heard my vows;
    you have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Prolong the life of the king;
    may his years endure to all generations!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he be enthroned forever before God;
    appoint steadfast love and faithfulness to watch over him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will always sing praises to your name,
    as I pay my vows day after day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God alone my soul waits in silence;
    from him comes my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He alone is my rock and my salvation,
    my fortress; I shall never be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you assail a person,
    will you batter your victim, all of you,
    as you would a leaning wall, a tottering fence?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their only plan is to bring down a person of prominence.
    They take pleasure in falsehood;
they bless with their mouths,
    but inwardly they curse. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God alone my soul waits in silence,
    for my hope is from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He alone is my rock and my salvation,
    my fortress; I shall not be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On God rests my deliverance and my honor;
    my mighty rock, my refuge is in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
and steadfast love belongs to you, O Lord.
For you repay to all
    according to their work.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So I have looked upon you in the sanctuary,
    beholding your power and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because your steadfast love is better than life,
    my lips will praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will bless you as long as I live;
    I will lift up my hands and call on your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul is satisfied as with a rich feast,
    and my mouth praises you with joyful lips
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when I think of you on my bed
    and meditate on you in the watches of the night,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for you have been my help,
    and in the shadow of your wings I sing for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul clings to you;
    your right hand upholds me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But those who seek to destroy my life
    shall go down into the depths of the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they shall be given over to the power of the sword;
    they shall be prey for jackals.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint;
    preserve my life from the dread enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide me from the secret plots of the wicked,
    from the scheming of evildoers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who whet their tongues like swords,
    who aim bitter words like arrows,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
shooting from ambush at the blameless;
    they shoot suddenly and without fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who can search out our crimes?
We have thought out a cunningly conceived plot.”
    For the human heart and mind are deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God will shoot his arrow at them;
    they will be wounded suddenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of their tongue he will bring them to ruin;
    all who see them will shake with horror.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let the righteous rejoice in the Lord
    and take refuge in him.
Let all the upright in heart glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise is due to you,
    O God, in Zion,
and to you shall vows be performed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O you who answer prayer!
To you all flesh shall come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When deeds of iniquity overwhelm us,
    you forgive our transgressions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are those whom you choose and bring near
    to live in your courts.
We shall be satisfied with the goodness of your house,
    your holy temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By awesome deeds you answer us with deliverance,
    O God of our salvation;
you are the hope of all the ends of the earth
    and of the farthest seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By your strength you established the mountains;
    you are girded with might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You silence the roaring of the seas,
    the roaring of their waves,
    the tumult of the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who live at earth’s farthest bounds are awed by your signs;
you make the gateways of the morning and the evening shout for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You water its furrows abundantly,
    settling its ridges,
softening it with showers,
    and blessing its growth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You crown the year with your bounty;
    your wagon tracks overflow with richness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The pastures of the wilderness overflow;
    the hills gird themselves with joy;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Make a joyful noise to God, all the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
sing the glory of his name;
    give to him glorious praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to God, “How awesome are your deeds!
    Because of your great power, your enemies cringe before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Come and see what God has done:
    he is awesome in his deeds among mortals.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
who rules by his might forever,
whose eyes keep watch on the nations—
    let the rebellious not exalt themselves. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless our God, O peoples;
    let the sound of his praise be heard,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who has kept us among the living
    and has not let our feet slip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you, O God, have tested us;
    you have tried us as silver is tried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You brought us into the net;
    you laid burdens on our backs;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will come into your house with burnt offerings;
    I will pay you my vows,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
those that my lips uttered
    and my mouth promised when I was in trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Come and hear, all you who fear God,
    and I will tell what he has done for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cried aloud to him,
    and he was extolled with my tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I had cherished iniquity in my heart,
    the Lord would not have listened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But truly God has listened;
    he has heard the words of my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be God,
    who has not rejected my prayer
    or removed his steadfast love from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May God be gracious to us and bless us
    and make his face to shine upon us, Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that your way may be known upon earth,
    your saving power among all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the peoples praise you, O God;
    let all the peoples praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the nations be glad and sing for joy,
    for you judge the peoples with equity
    and guide the nations upon earth. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the peoples praise you, O God;
    let all the peoples praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth has yielded its increase;
    God, our God, has blessed us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May God continue to bless us;
    let all the ends of the earth revere him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let God rise up; let his enemies be scattered;
    let those who hate him flee before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to God; sing praises to his name;
    lift up a song to him who rides upon the clouds—
his name is the Lord—
    be exultant before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Father of orphans and protector of widows
    is God in his holy habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O God, when you went out before your people,
    when you marched through the wilderness, Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the earth quaked, the heavens poured down rain
    at the presence of God, the God of Sinai,
    at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rain in abundance, O God, you showered abroad;
    you restored your heritage when it languished;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
your flock found a dwelling in it;
    in your goodness, O God, you provided for the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord gives the command;
    great is the company of those who bore the tidings:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The kings of the armies, they flee, they flee!”
The women at home divide the spoil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though they stay among the sheepfolds—
the wings of a dove covered with silver,
    its pinions with green gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Almighty scattered kings there,
    snow fell on Zalmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O mighty mountain, mountain of Bashan;
    O many-peaked mountain, mountain of Bashan!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you look with envy, O many-peaked mountain,
    at the mount that God desired for his abode,
    where the Lord will reside forever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With mighty chariotry, twice ten thousand,
    thousands upon thousands,
    the Lord came from Sinai into the holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You ascended the high mount,
    leading captives in your train
    and receiving gifts from people,
even from those who rebel against the Lord God’s abiding there.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Our God is a God of salvation,
    and to God, the Lord, belongs escape from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God will shatter the heads of his enemies,
    the hairy crown of those who walk in their guilty ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
so that you may bathe your feet in blood,
    so that the tongues of your dogs may have their share from the foe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your solemn processions are seen, O God,
    the processions of my God, my King, into the sanctuary—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the singers in front, the musicians last,
    between them young women playing tambourines:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Bless God in the great congregation,
    the Lord, O you who are of Israel’s fountain!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is Benjamin, the least of them, in the lead,
    the princes of Judah in a body,
    the princes of Zebulun, the princes of Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Summon your might, O God;
    show your strength, O God, as you have done for us before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of your temple at Jerusalem,
    kings bear gifts to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rebuke the wild animals that live among the reeds,
    the herd of bulls with the calves of the peoples.
Trample under foot those who lust after tribute;
    scatter the peoples who delight in war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let bronze be brought from Egypt;
    let Cush hasten to stretch out its hands to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to God, O kingdoms of the earth;
    sing praises to the Lord, Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O rider in the heavens, the ancient heavens;
    listen, he sends out his voice, his mighty voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe power to God,
    whose majesty is over Israel
    and whose power is in the skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Awesome is God in his sanctuary,
    the God of Israel;
    he gives power and strength to his people.
Blessed be God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save me, O God,
    for the waters have come up to my neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I sink in deep mire,
    where there is no foothold;
I have come into deep waters,
    and the flood sweeps over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am weary with my crying;
    my throat is parched.
My eyes grow dim
    with waiting for my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
More in number than the hairs of my head
    are those who hate me without cause;
many are those who would destroy me,
    my enemies who accuse me falsely.
What I did not steal,
    must I now restore?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, you know my folly;
    the wrongs I have done are not hidden from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let those who hope in you be put to shame because of me,
    O Lord God of hosts;
do not let those who seek you be dishonored because of me,
    O God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is for your sake that I have borne reproach,
    that shame has covered my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have become a stranger to my kindred,
    an alien to my mother’s children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is zeal for your house that has consumed me;
    the insults of those who insult you have fallen on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I humbled my soul with fasting,
    they insulted me for doing so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I made sackcloth my clothing,
    I became a byword to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am the subject of gossip for those who sit in the gate,
    and the drunkards make songs about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, my prayer is to you, O Lord.
    At an acceptable time, O God,
    in the abundance of your steadfast love, answer me.
With your faithful help
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
rescue me
    from sinking in the mire;
let me be delivered from my enemies
    and from the deep waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let the flood sweep over me
    or the deep swallow me up
    or the Pit close its mouth over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer me, O Lord, for your steadfast love is good;
    according to your abundant mercy, turn to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not hide your face from your servant,
    for I am in distress—make haste to answer me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Draw near to me; redeem me;
    set me free because of my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Insults have broken my heart,
    so that I am in despair.
I looked for pity, but there was none;
    and for comforters, but I found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They gave me poison for food,
    and for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let their table be a trap for them,
    a snare for their allies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let their eyes be darkened so that they cannot see,
    and make their loins tremble continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out your indignation upon them,
    and let your burning anger overtake them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May their camp be a desolation;
    let no one live in their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they persecute those whom you have struck down,
    and those whom you have wounded they attack still more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Add guilt to their guilt;
    may they have no acquittal from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be blotted out of the book of the living;
    let them not be enrolled among the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am lowly and in pain;
    let your salvation, O God, protect me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise the name of God with a song;
    I will magnify him with thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This will please the Lord more than an ox
    or a bull with horns and hoofs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the oppressed see it and be glad;
    you who seek God, let your hearts revive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord hears the needy
    and does not despise his own who are in bonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let heaven and earth praise him,
    the seas and everything that moves in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
the children of his servants shall inherit it,
    and those who love his name shall live in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be pleased, O God, to deliver me.
    O Lord, make haste to help me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those be put to shame and confusion
    who seek my life.
Let those be turned back and brought to dishonor
    who desire to hurt me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those who say, “Aha, Aha!”
    turn back because of their shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let all who seek you
    rejoice and be glad in you.
Let those who love your salvation
    say evermore, “God is great!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In you, O Lord, I take refuge;
    let me never be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In your righteousness deliver me and rescue me;
    incline your ear to me and save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be to me a rock of refuge,
    a strong fortress to save me,
    for you are my rock and my fortress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue me, O my God, from the hand of the wicked,
    from the grasp of the unjust and cruel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you, O Lord, are my hope,
    my trust, O Lord, from my youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From my birth I have leaned upon you,
    my protector since my mother’s womb.
My praise is continually of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have been like a portent to many,
    but you are my strong refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth is filled with your praise
    and with your glory all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not cast me off in the time of old age;
    do not forsake me when my strength is spent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my enemies speak concerning me,
    and those who watch for my life consult together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say, “Pursue and seize that person
    whom God has forsaken,
    for there is no one to deliver.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, do not be far from me;
    O my God, make haste to help me!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But I will hope continually
    and will praise you yet more and more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth will tell of your righteous acts,
    of your deeds of salvation all day long,
    though their number is past my knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will come praising the mighty deeds of the Lord God;
    I will praise your righteousness, yours alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, from my youth you have taught me,
    and I still proclaim your wondrous deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So even to old age and gray hairs,
    O God, do not forsake me,
until I proclaim your might
    to all the generations to come.
Your power
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and your righteousness, O God,
    reach the high heavens.
You who have done great things,
    O God, who is like you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who have made me see many troubles and calamities
    will revive me again;
from the depths of the earth
    you will bring me up again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will increase my honor
    and comfort me once again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also praise you with the harp
    for your faithfulness, O my God;
I will sing praises to you with the lyre,
    O Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All day long my tongue will talk of your righteous help,
for those who tried to do me harm
    have been put to shame and disgraced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give the king your justice, O God,
    and your righteousness to a king’s son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he judge your people with righteousness
    and your poor with justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the mountains yield prosperity for the people,
    and the hills, in righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he defend the cause of the poor of the people,
    give deliverance to the needy,
    and crush the oppressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he live while the sun endures
    and as long as the moon, throughout all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he be like rain that falls on the mown grass,
    like showers that water the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his days may righteousness flourish
    and peace abound, until the moon is no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he have dominion from sea to sea
    and from the River to the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his foes bow down before him,
    and his enemies lick the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the kings of Tarshish and of the isles
    render him tribute;
may the kings of Sheba and Seba
    bring gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May all kings fall down before him,
    all nations give him service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he delivers the needy when they call,
    the poor and those who have no helper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has pity on the weak and the needy
    and saves the lives of the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From oppression and violence he redeems their life,
    and precious is their blood in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Long may he live!
    May gold of Sheba be given to him.
May prayer be made for him continually
    and blessings invoked for him all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May his name endure forever,
    his fame continue as long as the sun.
May all nations be blessed in him;
    may they pronounce him happy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
    who alone does wondrous things.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The prayers of David son of Jesse are ended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly God is good to Israel,
    to those who are pure in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, my feet had almost stumbled;
    my steps had nearly slipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I was envious of the arrogant;
    I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they have no pain;
    their bodies are sound and sleek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are not in trouble as others are;
    they are not plagued like other people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore pride is their necklace;
    violence covers them like a garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their eyes swell out with fatness;
    their hearts overflow with follies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They scoff and speak with malice;
    loftily they threaten oppression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They set their mouths against heaven,
    and their tongues range over the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the people turn and praise them
    and find no fault in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they say, “How can God know?
    Is there knowledge in the Most High?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Such are the wicked;
    always at ease, they increase in riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All in vain I have kept my heart clean
    and washed my hands in innocence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all day long I have been plagued
    and am punished every morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I had said, “I will talk on in this way,”
    I would have been untrue to the circle of your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But when I thought how to understand this,
    it seemed to me a wearisome task,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until I went into the sanctuary of God;
    then I perceived their end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly you set them in slippery places;
    you make them fall to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How they are destroyed in a moment,
    swept away utterly by terrors!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are like a dream when one awakes;
    on awaking you despise their phantoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When my soul was embittered,
    when I was pricked in heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was stupid and ignorant;
    I was like a brute beast toward you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless, I am continually with you;
    you hold my right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You guide me with your counsel,
    and afterward you will receive me with honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whom have I in heaven but you?
    And there is nothing on earth that I desire other than you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My flesh and my heart may fail,
    but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, those who are far from you will perish;
    you put an end to those who are false to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O God, why do you cast us off forever?
    Why does your anger smoke against the sheep of your pasture?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember your congregation, which you acquired long ago,
    which you redeemed to be the tribe of your heritage.
    Remember Mount Zion, where you came to dwell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Direct your steps to the perpetual ruins;
    the enemy has destroyed everything in the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your foes have roared within your holy place;
    they set up their emblems there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the upper entrance they hacked
    the wooden trellis with axes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And then, with hatchets and hammers,
    they smashed all its carved work.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They said to themselves, “We will utterly subdue them”;
    they burned all the meeting places of God in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How long, O God, is the foe to scoff?
    Is the enemy to revile your name forever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you hold back your hand;
    why do you keep your hand in your bosom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet God my King is from of old,
    working salvation in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You divided the sea by your might;
    you broke the heads of the dragons in the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You crushed the heads of Leviathan;
    you gave him as food for the creatures of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You cut openings for springs and torrents;
    you dried up ever-flowing streams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yours is the day, yours also the night;
    you established the luminaries and the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have fixed all the bounds of the earth;
    you made summer and winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember this, O Lord, how the enemy scoffs,
    and an impious people reviles your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not deliver the soul of your dove to the wild animals;
    do not forget the life of your poor forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have regard for your covenant,
    for the dark places of the land are full of the haunts of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let the downtrodden be put to shame;
    let the poor and needy praise your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O God, plead your cause;
    remember how the impious scoff at you all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not forget the clamor of your foes,
    the uproar of your adversaries that goes up continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
At the set time that I appoint,
    I will judge with equity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the earth totters, with all its inhabitants,
    it is I who keep its pillars steady. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I say to the boastful, “Do not boast,”
    and to the wicked, “Do not lift up your horn;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
do not lift up your horn on high
    or speak with insolent neck.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For not from the east or from the west
    and not from the wilderness comes lifting up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but it is God who executes judgment,
    putting down one and lifting up another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup
    with foaming wine, well mixed;
he will pour a draught from it,
    and all the wicked of the earth
    shall drain it down to the dregs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I will rejoice forever;
    I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the horns of the wicked I will cut off,
    but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In Judah God is known;
    his name is great in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His abode has been established in Salem,
    his dwelling place in Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There he broke the flashing arrows,
    the shield, the sword, and the weapons of war. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Glorious are you, more majestic
    than the everlasting mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
At your rebuke, O God of Jacob,
    both rider and horse lay stunned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you indeed are awesome!
    Who can stand before you
    when your anger is roused?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the heavens you uttered judgment;
    the earth feared and was still
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when God rose up to establish judgment,
    to save all the oppressed of the earth. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Human wrath serves only to praise you,
    when you bind the last bit of your wrath around you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
who cuts off the spirit of princes,
    who inspires fear in the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cry aloud to God,
    aloud to God, that he may hear me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I think of God, and I moan;
    I meditate, and my spirit faints. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You keep my eyelids from closing;
    I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I consider the days of old
    and remember the years of long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I commune with my heart in the night;
    I meditate and search my spirit:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Will the Lord spurn forever
    and never again be favorable?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has his steadfast love ceased forever?
    Are his promises at an end for all time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has God forgotten to be gracious?
    Has he in anger shut up his compassion?” Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I say, “It is my grief
    that the right hand of the Most High has changed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will call to mind the deeds of the Lord;
    I will remember your wonders of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will meditate on all your work
    and muse on your mighty deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your way, O God, is holy.
    What god is so great as our God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are the God who works wonders;
    you have displayed your might among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With your strong arm you redeemed your people,
    the descendants of Jacob and Joseph. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your way was through the sea,
    your path through the mighty waters,
    yet your footprints were unseen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You led your people like a flock
    by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear, O my people, to my teaching;
    incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will open my mouth in a parable;
    I will utter dark sayings from of old,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
things that we have heard and known,
    that our ancestors have told us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We will not hide them from their children;
    we will tell to the coming generation
the glorious deeds of the Lord and his might
    and the wonders that he has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He established a decree in Jacob
    and appointed a law in Israel,
which he commanded our ancestors
    to teach to their children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that the next generation might know them,
    the children yet unborn,
and rise up and tell them to their children,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
and that they should not be like their ancestors,
    a stubborn and rebellious generation,
a generation whose heart was not steadfast,
    whose spirit was not faithful to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Ephraimites, armed with the bow,
    turned back on the day of battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not keep God’s covenant
    and refused to walk according to his law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They forgot what he had done
    and the miracles that he had shown them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the sight of their ancestors he worked marvels
    in the land of Egypt, in the fields of Zoan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He divided the sea and let them pass through it
    and made the waters stand like a heap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the daytime he led them with a cloud
    and all night long with a fiery light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He split rocks open in the wilderness
    and gave them drink abundantly as from the deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made streams come out of the rock
    and caused waters to flow down like rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet they sinned still more against him,
    rebelling against the Most High in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They tested God in their heart
    by demanding the food they craved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They spoke against God, saying,
    “Can God spread a table in the wilderness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even though he struck the rock so that water gushed out
    and torrents overflowed,
can he also give bread
    or provide meat for his people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
because they had no faith in God
    and did not trust his saving power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he commanded the skies above
    and opened the doors of heaven;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he rained down on them manna to eat
    and gave them the grain of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mortals ate of the bread of angels;
    he sent them food in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens,
    and by his power he led out the south wind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he rained flesh upon them like dust,
    winged birds like the sand of the seas;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he let them fall within their camp,
    all around their dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they ate and were well filled,
    for he gave them what they craved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But before they had satisfied their craving,
    while the food was still in their mouths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the anger of God rose against them,
    and he killed the strongest of them
    and laid low the flower of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In spite of all this they still sinned;
    they did not believe in his wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he made their days vanish like a breath
    and their years in terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he killed them, they searched for him;
    they repented and sought God earnestly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They remembered that God was their rock,
    the Most High God their redeemer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they flattered him with their mouths;
    they lied to him with their tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their heart was not steadfast toward him;
    they were not true to his covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he, being compassionate,
    forgave their iniquity
    and did not destroy them;
often he restrained his anger
    and did not stir up all his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He remembered that they were but flesh,
    a wind that passes and does not come again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness
    and grieved him in the desert!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They tested God again and again
    and provoked the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not keep in mind his power
    or the day when he redeemed them from the foe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when he displayed his signs in Egypt
    and his miracles in the fields of Zoan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned their rivers to blood,
    so that they could not drink of their streams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent among them swarms of flies that devoured them
    and frogs that destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave their crops to the caterpillar
    and the fruit of their labor to the locust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He destroyed their vines with hail
    and their sycamores with frost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave over their cattle to the hail
    and their flocks to thunderbolts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He let loose on them his fierce anger,
    wrath, indignation, and distress,
    a company of destroying angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He struck all the firstborn in Egypt,
    the first issue of their strength in the tents of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he led out his people like sheep
    and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He led them in safety so that they were not afraid,
    but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he brought them to his holy hill,
    to the mountain that his right hand had won.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Yet they tested the Most High God
    and rebelled against him.
    They did not observe his decrees
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but turned away and were faithless like their ancestors;
    they twisted like a treacherous bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they provoked him to anger with their high places;
    they moved him to jealousy with their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When God heard, he was full of wrath,
    and he utterly rejected Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He abandoned his dwelling at Shiloh,
    the tent where he dwelt among mortals,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and delivered his power to captivity,
    his glory to the hand of the foe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave his people to the sword
    and vented his wrath on his heritage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fire devoured their young men,
    and their young women had no marriage song.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their priests fell by the sword,
    and their widows made no lamentation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord awoke as from sleep,
    like a warrior shouting because of wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He put his adversaries to rout;
    he put them to everlasting disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rejected the tent of Joseph;
    he did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but he chose the tribe of Judah,
    Mount Zion, which he loves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He built his sanctuary like the high heavens,
    like the earth, which he has founded forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He chose his servant David
    and took him from the sheepfolds;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from tending the nursing ewes he brought him
    to be the shepherd of his people Jacob,
    of Israel, his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With upright heart he tended them
    and guided them with skillful hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They have given the bodies of your servants
    to the birds of the air for food,
    the flesh of your faithful to the wild animals of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have poured out their blood like water
    all around Jerusalem,
    and there was no one to bury them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have become a taunt to our neighbors,
    mocked and derided by those around us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, O Lord? Will you be angry forever?
    Will your jealous wrath burn like fire?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out your anger on the nations
    that do not know you
and on the kingdoms
    that do not call on your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they have devoured Jacob
    and laid waste his habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Help us, O God of our salvation,
    for the glory of your name;
deliver us and forgive our sins,
    for your name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should the nations say,
    “Where is their God?”
Let the avenging of the outpoured blood of your servants
    be known among the nations before our eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the groans of the prisoners come before you;
    according to your great power, preserve those doomed to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return sevenfold into the bosom of our neighbors
    the taunts with which they taunted you, O Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel,
    you who lead Joseph like a flock!
You who are enthroned upon the cherubim, shine forth
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh.
Stir up your might,
    and come to save us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore us, O God;
    let your face shine, that we may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord God of hosts,
    how long will you be angry with your people’s prayers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have fed them with the bread of tears
    and given them tears to drink in full measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You make us the scorn of our neighbors;
    our enemies laugh among themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore us, O God of hosts;
    let your face shine, that we may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You brought a vine out of Egypt;
    you drove out the nations and planted it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You cleared the ground for it;
    it took deep root and filled the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains were covered with its shade,
    the mighty cedars with its branches;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
it sent out its branches to the sea
    and its shoots to the River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why then have you broken down its walls,
    so that all who pass along the way pluck its fruit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The boar from the forest ravages it,
    and all that move in the field feed on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: the stock that your right hand planted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It has been burned with fire; it has been cut down;
    may they perish at the rebuke of your countenance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But let your hand be upon the one at your right hand,
    the one whom you made strong for yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then we will never turn back from you;
    give us life, and we will call on your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore us, O Lord God of hosts;
    let your face shine, that we may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing aloud to God our strength;
    shout for joy to the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Raise a song; sound the tambourine,
    the sweet lyre with the harp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blow the trumpet at the new moon,
    at the full moon, on our festal day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is a statute for Israel,
    an ordinance of the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made it a decree in Joseph,
    when he went out over the land of Egypt.
I hear a voice I had not known:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I relieved your shoulder of the burden;
    your hands were freed from the basket.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O my people, while I admonish you;
    O Israel, if you would but listen to me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There shall be no strange god among you;
    you shall not bow down to a foreign god.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am the Lord your God,
    who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.
    Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But my people did not listen to my voice;
    Israel would not submit to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I gave them over to their stubborn hearts,
    to follow their own counsels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O that my people would listen to me,
    that Israel would walk in my ways!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I would quickly subdue their enemies
    and turn my hand against their foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who hate the Lord would cringe before him,
    and their doom would last forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would feed you with the finest of the wheat,
    and with honey from the rock I would satisfy you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has taken his place in the divine council;
    in the midst of the gods he holds judgment:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long will you judge unjustly
    and show partiality to the wicked? Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give justice to the weak and the orphan;
    maintain the right of the lowly and the destitute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue the weak and the needy;
    deliver them from the hand of the wicked.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I say, “You are gods,
    children of the Most High, all of you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
nevertheless, you shall die like mortals
    and fall like any prince.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O God, judge the earth,
    for all the nations belong to you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, do not keep silent;
    do not hold your peace or be still, O God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even now your enemies are in tumult;
    those who hate you have raised their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They lay crafty plans against your people;
    they consult together against those you protect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say, “Come, let us wipe them out as a nation;
    let the name of Israel be remembered no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They conspire with one accord;
    against you they make a covenant—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites,
    Moab and the Hagrites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gebal and Ammon and Amalek,
    Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Assyria also has joined them;
    they are the strong arm of the children of Lot. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do to them as you did to Midian,
    as to Sisera and Jabin at the Wadi Kishon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who were destroyed at En-dor,
    who became dung for the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb,
    all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who said, “Let us take the pastures of God
    for our own possession.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O my God, make them like whirling dust,
    like chaff before the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As fire consumes the forest,
    as the flame sets the mountains ablaze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so pursue them with your tempest
    and terrify them with your hurricane.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fill their faces with shame,
    so that they may seek your name, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be put to shame and dismayed forever;
    let them perish in disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them know that you alone,
    whose name is the Lord,
    are the Most High over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How lovely is your dwelling place,
    O Lord of hosts!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul longs, indeed it faints,
    for the courts of the Lord;
my heart and my flesh sing for joy
    to the living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the sparrow finds a home
    and the swallow a nest for herself,
    where she may lay her young,
at your altars, O Lord of hosts,
    my King and my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are those who live in your house,
    ever singing your praise. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are those whose strength is in you,
    in whose heart are the highways to Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They go from strength to strength;
    the God of gods will be seen in Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer;
    give ear, O God of Jacob! Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold our shield, O God;
    look on the face of your anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a day in your courts is better
    than a thousand elsewhere.
I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God
    than live in the tents of wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord God is a sun and shield;
    he bestows favor and honor.
No good thing does the Lord withhold
    from those who walk uprightly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord of hosts,
    happy is everyone who trusts in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, you were favorable to your land;
    you restored the fortunes of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You forgave the iniquity of your people;
    you pardoned all their sin. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You withdrew all your wrath;
    you turned from your hot anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore us again, O God of our salvation,
    and put away your indignation toward us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you be angry with us forever?
    Will you prolong your anger to all generations?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you not revive us again,
    so that your people may rejoice in you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Show us your steadfast love, O Lord,
    and grant us your salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Surely his salvation is at hand for those who fear him,
    that his glory may dwell in our land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Steadfast love and faithfulness will meet;
    righteousness and peace will kiss each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Faithfulness will spring up from the ground,
    and righteousness will look down from the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will give what is good,
    and our land will yield its increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness will go before him
    and will make a path for his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Incline your ear, O Lord, and answer me,
    for I am poor and needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
be gracious to me, O Lord,
    for to you do I cry all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gladden the soul of your servant,
    for to you, O Lord, I lift up my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you, O Lord, are good and forgiving,
    abounding in steadfast love to all who call on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear, O Lord, to my prayer;
    listen to my cry of supplication.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the day of my trouble I call on you,
    for you will answer me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is none like you among the gods, O Lord,
    nor are there any works like yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the nations you have made shall come
    and bow down before you, O Lord,
    and shall glorify your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you are great and do wondrous things;
    you alone are God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I give thanks to you, O Lord my God, with my whole heart,
    and I will glorify your name forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is your steadfast love toward me;
    you have delivered my soul from the depths of Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious,
    slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Show me a sign of your favor,
    so that those who hate me may see it and be put to shame,
    because you, Lord, have helped me and comforted me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the holy mount stands the city he founded;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the Lord loves the gates of Zion
    more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Glorious things are spoken of you,
    O city of God. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And of Zion it shall be said,
    “This one and that one were born in it,”
    for the Most High himself will establish it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord records, as he registers the peoples,
    “This one was born there.” Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Singers and dancers alike say,
    “All my springs are in you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, God of my salvation,
    at night, when I cry out before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
let my prayer come before you;
    incline your ear to my cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my soul is full of troubles,
    and my life draws near to Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am counted among those who go down to the Pit;
    I am like those who have no help,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
like those forsaken among the dead,
    like the slain that lie in the grave,
like those whom you remember no more,
    for they are cut off from your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have put me in the depths of the Pit,
    in the regions dark and deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wrath lies heavy upon me,
    and you overwhelm me with all your waves. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do you work wonders for the dead?
    Do the shades rise up to praise you? Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is your steadfast love declared in the grave
    or your faithfulness in Abaddon?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are your wonders known in the darkness
    or your saving help in the land of forgetfulness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I, O Lord, cry out to you;
    in the morning my prayer comes before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, why do you cast me off?
    Why do you hide your face from me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wretched and close to death from my youth up,
    I suffer your terrors; I am desperate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wrath has swept over me;
    your dread assaults destroy me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They surround me like a flood all day long;
    from all sides they close in on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have caused friend and neighbor to shun me;
    my companions are in darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing of your steadfast love, O Lord, forever;
    with my mouth I will proclaim your faithfulness to all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I declare that your steadfast love is established forever;
    your faithfulness is as firm as the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You said, “I have made a covenant with my chosen one;
    I have sworn to my servant David:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I will establish your descendants forever
    and build your throne for all generations.’ ” Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the heavens praise your wonders, O Lord,
    your faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For who in the skies can be compared to the Lord?
    Who among the heavenly beings is like the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a God feared in the council of the holy ones,
