    great and awesome above all who are around him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord God of hosts,
    who is as mighty as you, O Lord?
    Your faithfulness surrounds you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You rule the raging of the sea;
    when its waves rise, you still them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You crushed Rahab like a carcass;
    you scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens are yours; the earth also is yours;
    the world and all that is in it—you founded them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The north and the south—you created them;
    Tabor and Hermon joyously praise your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have a mighty arm;
    strong is your hand, high your right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne;
    steadfast love and faithfulness go before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are the people who know the festal shout,
    who walk, O Lord, in the light of your countenance;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they exult in your name all day long
    and extol your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you are the glory of their strength;
    by your favor our horn is exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For our shield belongs to the Lord,
    our king to the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I have found my servant David;
    with my holy oil I have anointed him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my hand shall always remain with him;
    my arm also shall strengthen him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The enemy shall not outwit him;
    the wicked shall not humble him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will crush his foes before him
    and strike down those who hate him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My faithfulness and steadfast love shall be with him,
    and in my name his horn shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will set his hand on the sea
    and his right hand on the rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall cry to me, ‘You are my Father,
    my God, and the Rock of my salvation!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make him the firstborn,
    the highest of the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Forever I will keep my steadfast love for him,
    and my covenant with him will stand firm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will establish his line forever
    and his throne as long as the heavens endure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If his children forsake my law
    and do not walk according to my ordinances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if they violate my statutes
    and do not keep my commandments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then I will punish their transgression with the rod
    and their iniquity with scourges,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but I will not remove from him my steadfast love
    or be false to my faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not violate my covenant
    or alter the word that went forth from my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Once and for all I have sworn by my holiness;
    I will not lie to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His line shall continue forever,
    and his throne endure before me like the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall be established forever like the moon,
    an enduring witness in the skies.” Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now you have spurned and rejected him;
    you are full of wrath against your anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have renounced the covenant with your servant;
    you have defiled his crown in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have broken through all his walls;
    you have laid his strongholds in ruins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who pass by plunder him;
    he has become the scorn of his neighbors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have exalted the right hand of his foes;
    you have made all his enemies rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover, you have turned back the edge of his sword,
    and you have not supported him in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have removed the scepter from his hand
    and hurled his throne to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have cut short the days of his youth;
    you have covered him with shame. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, O Lord? Will you hide yourself forever?
    How long will your wrath burn like fire?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember how short my time is—
    for what vanity you have created all mortals!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can live and never see death?
    Who can escape the power of Sheol? Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, where is your steadfast love of old,
    which by your faithfulness you swore to David?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, O Lord, how your servant is taunted,
    how I bear in my bosom the insults of the peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with which your enemies taunt, O Lord,
    with which they taunted the footsteps of your anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord forever.
                Amen and Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, you have been our dwelling place
    in all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before the mountains were brought forth
    or ever you had formed the earth and the world,
    from everlasting to everlasting you are God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You turn us back to dust
    and say, “Turn back, you mortals.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a thousand years in your sight
    are like yesterday when it is past
    or like a watch in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You sweep them away; they are like a dream,
    like grass that is renewed in the morning;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in the morning it flourishes and is renewed;
    in the evening it fades and withers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For we are consumed by your anger;
    by your wrath we are overwhelmed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have set our iniquities before you,
    our secret sins in the light of your countenance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all our days pass away under your wrath;
    our years come to an end like a sigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who considers the power of your anger?
    Your wrath is as great as the fear that is due you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So teach us to count our days
    that we may gain a wise heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn, O Lord! How long?
    Have compassion on your servants!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Satisfy us in the morning with your steadfast love,
    so that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make us glad as many days as you have afflicted us
    and as many years as we have seen evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your work be manifest to your servants
    and your glorious power to their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us
    and prosper for us the work of our hands—
    O prosper the work of our hands!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who live in the shelter of the Most High,
    who abide in the shadow of the Almighty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
will say to the Lord, “My refuge and my fortress;
    my God, in whom I trust.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he will deliver you from the snare of the hunter
    and from the deadly pestilence;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You will not fear the terror of the night
    or the arrow that flies by day
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
or the pestilence that stalks in darkness
    or the destruction that wastes at noonday.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A thousand may fall at your side,
    ten thousand at your right hand,
    but it will not come near you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will only look with your eyes
    and see the punishment of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because you have made the Lord your refuge,
    the Most High your dwelling place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
no evil shall befall you,
    no scourge come near your tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he will command his angels concerning you
    to guard you in all your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On their hands they will bear you up,
    so that you will not dash your foot against a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will tread on the lion and the adder;
    the young lion and the serpent you will trample under foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who love me, I will deliver;
    I will protect those who know my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
With long life I will satisfy them
    and show them my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good to give thanks to the Lord,
    to sing praises to your name, O Most High,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to declare your steadfast love in the morning
    and your faithfulness by night,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to the music of the lute and the harp,
    to the melody of the lyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you, O Lord, have made me glad by your work;
    at the works of your hands I sing for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How great are your works, O Lord!
    Your thoughts are very deep!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The dullard cannot know;
    the stupid cannot understand this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though the wicked sprout like grass
    and all evildoers flourish,
they are doomed to destruction forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you, O Lord, are on high forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But you have exalted my horn like that of the wild ox;
    you have anointed me with fresh oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes have seen the downfall of my enemies;
    my ears have heard the doom of my evil assailants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous flourish like the palm tree
    and grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are planted in the house of the Lord;
    they flourish in the courts of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In old age they still produce fruit;
    they are always green and full of sap,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
showing that the Lord is upright;
    he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
your throne is established from of old;
    you are from everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
More majestic than the thunders of mighty waters,
    more majestic than the waves of the sea,
    majestic on high is the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, you God of vengeance,
    you God of vengeance, shine forth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O judge of the earth;
    give to the proud what they deserve!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, how long shall the wicked,
    how long shall the wicked exult?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They pour out their arrogant words;
    all the evildoers boast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They crush your people, O Lord,
    and afflict your heritage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They kill the widow and the stranger;
    they murder the orphan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and they say, “The Lord does not see;
    the God of Jacob does not perceive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Understand, O dullest of the people;
    fools, when will you be wise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who planted the ear, does he not hear?
He who formed the eye, does he not see?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who disciplines the nations,
he who teaches knowledge to humankind,
    does he not chastise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord knows our thoughts,
    that they are but an empty breath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are those whom you discipline, O Lord,
    and whom you teach out of your law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
giving them respite from days of trouble,
    until a pit is dug for the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will not forsake his people;
    he will not abandon his heritage;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for justice will return to the righteous,
    and all the upright in heart will follow it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who rises up for me against the wicked?
    Who stands up for me against evildoers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If the Lord had not been my help,
    my soul would soon have lived in the land of silence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I thought, “My foot is slipping,”
    your steadfast love, O Lord, held me up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the cares of my heart are many,
    your consolations cheer my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can wicked rulers be allied with you,
    those who contrive mischief by statute?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They band together against the life of the righteous
    and condemn the innocent to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord has become my stronghold
    and my God the rock of my refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O come, let us sing to the Lord;
    let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us come into his presence with thanksgiving;
    let us make a joyful noise to him with songs of praise!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord is a great God
    and a great King above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his hand are the depths of the earth;
    the heights of the mountains are his also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sea is his, for he made it,
    and the dry land, which his hands have formed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O come, let us worship and bow down;
    let us kneel before the Lord, our Maker!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he is our God,
    and we are the people of his pasture
    and the sheep of his hand.
O that today you would listen to his voice!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not harden your hearts, as at Meribah,
    as on the day at Massah in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when your ancestors tested me
    and put me to the proof, though they had seen my work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For forty years I loathed that generation
    and said, “They are a people whose hearts go astray,
    and they do not regard my ways.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore in my anger I swore,
    “They shall not enter my rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O sing to the Lord a new song;
    sing to the Lord, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord; bless his name;
    tell of his salvation from day to day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Declare his glory among the nations,
    his marvelous works among all the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is the Lord and greatly to be praised;
    he is to be revered above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all the gods of the peoples are idols,
    but the Lord made the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honor and majesty are before him;
    strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord, O families of the peoples,
    ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord the glory due his name;
    bring an offering, and come into his courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Worship the Lord in holy splendor;
    tremble before him, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say among the nations, “The Lord is king!
    The world is firmly established; it shall never be moved.
    He will judge the peoples with equity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice;
    let the sea roar and all that fills it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
let the field exult and everything in it.
Then shall all the trees of the forest sing for joy
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
before the Lord, for he is coming,
    for he is coming to judge the earth.
He will judge the world with righteousness
    and the peoples with his truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is king! Let the earth rejoice;
    let the many coastlands be glad!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Clouds and thick darkness are all around him;
    righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fire goes before him
    and consumes his adversaries on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His lightnings light up the world;
    the earth sees and trembles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains melt like wax before the Lord,
    before the Lord of all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens proclaim his righteousness,
    and all the peoples behold his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Zion hears and is glad,
    and the towns of Judah rejoice
    because of your judgments, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you, O Lord, are most high over all the earth;
    you are exalted far above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Light dawns for the righteous
    and joy for the upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice in the Lord, O you righteous,
    and give thanks to his holy name!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O sing to the Lord a new song,
    for he has done marvelous things.
His right hand and his holy arm
    have gotten him victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has made known his victory;
    he has revealed his vindication in the sight of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has remembered his steadfast love and faithfulness
    to the house of Israel.
All the ends of the earth have seen
    the victory of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make a joyful noise to the Lord, all the earth;
    break forth into joyous song and sing praises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing praises to the Lord with the lyre,
    with the lyre and the sound of melody.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With trumpets and the sound of the horn
    make a joyful noise before the King, the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the sea roar and all that fills it,
    the world and those who live in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the floods clap their hands;
    let the hills sing together for joy
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
at the presence of the Lord, for he is coming
    to judge the earth.
He will judge the world with righteousness
    and the peoples with equity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is king; let the peoples tremble!
    He sits enthroned upon the cherubim; let the earth quake!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is great in Zion;
    he is exalted over all the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them praise your great and awesome name.
    Holy is he!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mighty King, lover of justice,
    you have established equity;
you have executed justice
    and righteousness in Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Moses and Aaron were among his priests,
    Samuel also was among those who called on his name.
    They cried to the Lord, and he answered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Extol the Lord our God,
    and worship at his holy mountain,
    for the Lord our God is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make a joyful noise to the Lord, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Serve the Lord with gladness;
    come into his presence with singing.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Enter his gates with thanksgiving
    and his courts with praise.
    Give thanks to him; bless his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing of loyalty and of justice;
    to you, O Lord, I will sing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will study the way that is blameless.
    When shall I attain it?
I will walk with integrity of heart
    within my house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not set before my eyes
    anything that is base.
I hate the work of those who fall away;
    it shall not cling to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Perverseness of heart shall be far from me;
    I will know nothing of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who secretly slanders a neighbor
    I will destroy.
A haughty look and an arrogant heart
    I will not tolerate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will look with favor on the faithful in the land,
    so that they may live with me;
whoever walks in the way that is blameless
    shall minister to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one who practices deceit
    shall remain in my house;
no one who utters lies
    shall continue in my presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Morning by morning I will destroy
    all the wicked in the land,
cutting off all evildoers
    from the city of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my prayer, O Lord;
    let my cry come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not hide your face from me
    in the day of my distress.
Incline your ear to me;
    answer me speedily in the day when I call.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my days pass away like smoke,
    and my bones burn like a furnace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is stricken and withered like grass;
    I am too wasted to eat my bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of my loud groaning,
    my bones cling to my skin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am like a desert owl of the wilderness,
    like a little owl of the waste places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lie awake;
    I am like a lonely bird on the housetop.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long my enemies taunt me;
    those who deride me use my name for a curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, I eat ashes like bread
    and mingle tears with my drink,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of your indignation and anger,
    for you have lifted me up and thrown me aside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My days are like a lengthening shadow;
    I wither away like grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O Lord, are enthroned forever;
    your name endures to all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For your servants hold its stones dear
    and have pity on its dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nations will fear the name of the Lord
    and all the kings of the earth your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will build up Zion;
    he will appear in his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will regard the prayer of the destitute
    and will not despise their prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let this be recorded for a generation to come,
    so that a people yet unborn may praise the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that he looked down from his holy height,
    from heaven the Lord looked at the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to hear the groans of the prisoners,
    to set free those who were doomed to die,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that the name of the Lord may be declared in Zion
    and his praise in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when peoples gather together,
    and kingdoms, to serve the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has broken my strength in midcourse;
    he has shortened my days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O my God,” I say, “do not take me away
    at the midpoint of my life,
you whose years endure
    throughout all generations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Long ago you laid the foundation of the earth,
    and the heavens are the work of your hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: but you are the same, and your years have no end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The children of your servants shall live secure;
    their offspring shall be established in your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, O my soul,
    and all that is within me,
    bless his holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, O my soul,
    and do not forget all his benefits—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who forgives all your iniquity,
    who heals all your diseases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who redeems your life from the Pit,
    who crowns you with steadfast love and mercy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who satisfies you with good as long as you live
    so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord works vindication
    and justice for all who are oppressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made known his ways to Moses,
    his acts to the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is merciful and gracious,
    slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not always accuse,
    nor will he keep his anger forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He does not deal with us according to our sins
    nor repay us according to our iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For as the heavens are high above the earth,
    so great is his steadfast love toward those who fear him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
as far as the east is from the west,
    so far he removes our transgressions from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a father has compassion for his children,
    so the Lord has compassion for those who fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he knows how we were made;
    he remembers that we are dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for mortals, their days are like grass;
    they flourish like a flower of the field;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the wind passes over it, and it is gone,
    and its place knows it no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the steadfast love of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting
    on those who fear him,
    and his righteousness to children’s children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to those who keep his covenant
    and remember to do his commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has established his throne in the heavens,
    and his kingdom rules over all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, O you his angels,
    you mighty ones who do his bidding,
    obedient to his spoken word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, all his hosts,
    his ministers who do his will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, all his works,
    in all places of his dominion.
Bless the Lord, O my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, O my soul.
    O Lord my God, you are very great.
You are clothed with honor and majesty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
wrapped in light as with a garment.
You stretch out the heavens like a tent;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
you make the winds your messengers,
    fire and flame your ministers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You set the earth on its foundations,
    so that it shall never be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You cover it with the deep as with a garment;
    the waters stood above the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At your rebuke they flee;
    at the sound of your thunder they take to flight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They rose up to the mountains, ran down to the valleys,
    to the place that you appointed for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You set a boundary that they may not pass,
    so that they might not again cover the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You make springs gush forth in the valleys;
    they flow between the hills,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
giving drink to every wild animal;
    the wild asses quench their thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the streams the birds of the air have their habitation;
    they sing among the branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From your lofty abode you water the mountains;
    the earth is satisfied with the fruit of your work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You cause the grass to grow for the cattle
    and plants for people to cultivate,
to bring forth food from the earth
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and wine to gladden the human heart,
oil to make the face shine
    and bread to strengthen the human heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The trees of the field are watered abundantly,
    the cedars of Lebanon that he planted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In them the birds build their nests;
    the stork has its home in the fir trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The high mountains are for the wild goats;
    the rocks are a refuge for the coneys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made the moon to mark the seasons;
    the sun knows its time for setting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You make darkness, and it is night,
    when all the animals of the forest come creeping out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The young lions roar for their prey,
    seeking their food from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the sun rises, they withdraw
    and lie down in their dens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People go out to their work
    and to their labor until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
There go the ships
    and Leviathan that you formed to sport in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These all look to you
    to give them their food in due season;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when you give to them, they gather it up;
    when you open your hand, they are filled with good things.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When you send forth your spirit, they are created,
    and you renew the face of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the glory of the Lord endure forever;
    may the Lord rejoice in his works—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who looks on the earth and it trembles,
    who touches the mountains and they smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing to the Lord as long as I live;
    I will sing praise to my God while I have being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my meditation be pleasing to him,
    for I rejoice in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let sinners be consumed from the earth,
    and let the wicked be no more.
Bless the Lord, O my soul.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O give thanks to the Lord; call on his name;
    make known his deeds among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to him, sing praises to him;
    tell of all his wonderful works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Glory in his holy name;
    let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seek the Lord and his strength;
    seek his presence continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember the wonderful works he has done,
    his miracles and the judgments he has uttered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O offspring of his servant Abraham,
    children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the Lord our God;
    his judgments are in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is mindful of his covenant forever,
    of the word that he commanded for a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the covenant that he made with Abraham,
    his sworn promise to Isaac,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which he confirmed to Jacob as a statute,
    to Israel as an everlasting covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
    as your portion for an inheritance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they were few in number,
    of little account and strangers in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
wandering from nation to nation,
    from one kingdom to another people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he allowed no one to oppress them;
    he rebuked kings on their account,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying, “Do not touch my anointed ones;
    do my prophets no harm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he summoned famine against the land
    and cut off every supply of bread,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he had sent a man ahead of them,
    Joseph, who had been sold as a slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His feet were hurt with fetters;
    his neck was put in a collar of iron;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until what he had said came to pass,
    the word of the Lord kept testing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king sent and released him;
    the ruler of the peoples set him free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made him lord of his house
    and ruler of all his possessions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to instruct his officials at his pleasure
    and to teach his elders wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Israel came to Egypt;
    Jacob lived as an alien in the land of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the Lord made his people very fruitful
    and made them stronger than their foes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
whose hearts he then turned to hate his people,
    to deal craftily with his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent his servant Moses
    and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They performed his signs among them
    and miracles in the land of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent darkness and made the land dark;
    they rebelled against his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned their waters into blood
    and caused their fish to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their land swarmed with frogs,
    even in the chambers of their kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spoke, and there came swarms of flies
    and gnats throughout their country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave them hail for rain
    and lightning that flashed through their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He struck their vines and fig trees
    and shattered the trees of their country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spoke, and the locusts came,
    and young locusts without number;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they devoured all the vegetation in their land
    and ate up the fruit of their ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He struck down all the firstborn in their land,
    the first issue of all their strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he brought Israel out with silver and gold,
    and there was no one among their tribes who stumbled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Egypt was glad when they departed,
    for dread of them had fallen upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spread a cloud for a covering
    and fire to give light by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They asked, and he brought quails
    and gave them food from heaven in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He opened the rock, and water gushed out;
    it flowed through the desert like a river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he remembered his holy promise
    and Abraham, his servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he brought his people out with joy,
    his chosen ones with singing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave them the lands of the nations,
    and they took possession of the wealth of the peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that they might keep his statutes
    and observe his laws.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord!
    O give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
    for his steadfast love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can utter the mighty doings of the Lord
    or declare all his praise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are those who observe justice,
    who do righteousness at all times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember us, O Lord, when you show favor to your people;
    help us when you deliver them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that we may see the prosperity of your chosen ones,
    that we may rejoice in the gladness of your nation,
    that we may glory in your heritage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Both we and our ancestors have sinned;
    we have committed iniquity, have done wickedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our ancestors, when they were in Egypt,
    did not consider your wonderful works;
they did not remember the abundance of your steadfast love
    but rebelled against the Most High at the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he saved them for his name’s sake,
    so that he might make known his mighty power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rebuked the Red Sea, and it became dry;
    he led them through the deep as through a desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he saved them from the hand of the foe
    and delivered them from the hand of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The waters covered their adversaries;
    not one of them was left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they believed his words;
    they sang his praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they soon forgot his works;
    they did not wait for his counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they had a wanton craving in the wilderness
    and put God to the test in the desert;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he gave them what they asked
    but sent a wasting disease among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were jealous of Moses in the camp
    and of Aaron, the holy one of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan
    and covered the faction of Abiram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fire also broke out in their company;
    the flame burned up the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They made a calf at Horeb
    and worshiped a cast image.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They exchanged the glory of God
    for the image of an ox that eats grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They forgot God, their Savior,
    who had done great things in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
wondrous works in the land of Ham,
    and awesome deeds by the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore he said he would destroy them—
    had not Moses, his chosen one,
stood in the breach before him,
    to turn away his wrath from destroying them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they despised the pleasant land,
    having no faith in his promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They grumbled in their tents
    and did not obey the voice of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore he raised his hand and swore to them
    that he would make them fall in the wilderness
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and would disperse their descendants among the nations,
    scattering them over the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they attached themselves to the Baal of Peor
    and ate sacrifices offered to the dead;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they provoked the Lord to anger with their deeds,
    and a plague broke out among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Phinehas stood up and interceded,
    and the plague was stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And that has been reckoned to him as righteousness
    from generation to generation forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They angered the Lord at the waters of Meribah,
    and it went ill with Moses on their account,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for they made his spirit bitter,
    and he spoke words that were rash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not destroy the peoples,
    as the Lord had commanded them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but they mingled with the nations
    and learned to do as they did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They served their idols,
    which became a snare to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sacrificed their sons
    and their daughters to the demons;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they poured out innocent blood,
    the blood of their sons and daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan,
    and the land was polluted with blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus they became unclean by their acts
    and prostituted themselves in their doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the anger of the Lord was kindled against his people,
    and he abhorred his heritage;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he gave them into the hand of the nations,
    so that those who hated them ruled over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their enemies oppressed them,
    and they were brought into subjection under their power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many times he delivered them,
    but they were rebellious in their purposes
    and were brought low through their iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless, he regarded their distress
    when he heard their cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their sake he remembered his covenant
    and showed compassion according to the abundance of his steadfast love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He caused them to be pitied
    by all who held them captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save us, O Lord our God,
    and gather us from among the nations,
that we may give thanks to your holy name
    and glory in your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
    from everlasting to everlasting.
And let all the people say, “Amen.”
    Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
    for his steadfast love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the redeemed of the Lord say so,
    those he redeemed from trouble
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Some wandered in desert wastes,
    finding no way to an inhabited town;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
hungry and thirsty,
    their soul fainted within them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,
    and he delivered them from their distress;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he led them by a straight way,
    until they reached an inhabited town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them thank the Lord for his steadfast love,
    for his wonderful works to humankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he satisfies the thirsty,
    and the hungry he fills with good things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some sat in darkness and in gloom,
    prisoners in misery and in irons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for they had rebelled against the words of God
    and spurned the counsel of the Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their hearts were bowed down with hard labor;
    they fell down, with no one to help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,
    and he saved them from their distress;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he brought them out of darkness and gloom,
    and broke their bonds apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them thank the Lord for his steadfast love,
    for his wonderful works to humankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he shatters the doors of bronze
    and cuts in two the bars of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some were sick through their sinful ways
    and because of their iniquities endured affliction;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they loathed any kind of food,
    and they drew near to the gates of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,
    and he saved them from their distress;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he sent out his word and healed them
    and delivered them from destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them thank the Lord for his steadfast love,
    for his wonderful works to humankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And let them offer thanksgiving sacrifices
    and tell of his deeds with songs of joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some went down to the sea in ships,
    doing business on the mighty waters;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they saw the deeds of the Lord,
    his wondrous works in the deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he commanded and raised the stormy wind,
    which lifted up the waves of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They mounted up to heaven; they went down to the depths;
    their courage melted away in their calamity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they reeled and staggered like drunkards
    and were at their wits’ end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,
    and he brought them out from their distress;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he made the storm be still,
    and the waves of the sea were hushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they were glad because they had quiet,
    and he brought them to their desired haven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them thank the Lord for his steadfast love,
    for his wonderful works to humankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them extol him in the congregation of the people
    and praise him in the assembly of the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turns rivers into a desert,
    springs of water into thirsty ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a fruitful land into a salty waste,
    because of the wickedness of its inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turns a desert into pools of water,
    a parched land into springs of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And there he lets the hungry live,
    and they establish a town to live in;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they sow fields and plant vineyards
    and get a fruitful yield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By his blessing they multiply greatly,
    and he does not let their cattle decrease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they are diminished and brought low
    through oppression, trouble, and sorrow,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he pours contempt on princes
    and makes them wander in trackless wastes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but he raises up the needy out of distress
    and makes their families like flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The upright see it and are glad,
    and all wickedness stops its mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those who are wise pay attention to these things
    and consider the steadfast love of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, O harp and lyre!
    I will awake the dawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks to you, O Lord, among the peoples,
    and I will sing praises to you among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For your steadfast love is higher than the heavens,
    and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens,
    and let your glory be over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give victory with your right hand, and answer me,
    so that those whom you love may be rescued.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has promised in his sanctuary:
    “With exultation I will divide up Shechem
    and portion out the Vale of Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who will bring me to the fortified city?
    Who will lead me to Edom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not rejected us, O God?
    You do not go out, O God, with our armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O grant us help against the foe,
    for human help is worthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With God we shall do valiantly;
    it is he who will tread down our foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be silent, O God of my praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For wicked and deceitful mouths are opened against me,
    speaking against me with lying tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They surround me with words of hate
    and attack me without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In return for my love they accuse me,
    even while I make prayer for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they reward me evil for good
    and hatred for my love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say, “Appoint a wicked man against him;
    let an accuser stand on his right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he is tried, let him be found guilty;
    let his prayer be counted as sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his days be few;
    may another seize his position.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his children be orphans
    and his wife a widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his children wander about and beg;
    may they be driven out of the ruins they inhabit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the creditor seize all that he has;
    may strangers plunder the fruits of his toil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May there be no one to do him a kindness
    nor anyone to pity his orphaned children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his posterity be cut off;
    may his name be blotted out in the second generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the iniquity of his father be remembered before the Lord,
    and do not let the sin of his mother be blotted out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be before the Lord continually,
    and may his memory be cut off from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he did not remember to show kindness
    but pursued the poor and needy
    and the brokenhearted to their death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He loved to curse; let curses come on him.
    He did not like blessing; may it be far from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May it be like a garment that he wraps around himself,
    like a belt that he wears every day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May that be the reward of my accusers from the Lord,
    of those who speak evil against my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For I am poor and needy,
    and my heart is pierced within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am gone like a shadow at evening;
    I am shaken off like a locust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My knees are weak through fasting;
    my body has become gaunt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am an object of scorn to my accusers;
    when they see me, they shake their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Help me, O Lord my God!
    Save me according to your steadfast love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them know that this is your hand;
    you, O Lord, have done it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them curse, but you will bless.
    Let my assailants be put to shame; may your servant be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my accusers be clothed with dishonor;
    may they be wrapped in their own shame as in a mantle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With my mouth I will give great thanks to the Lord;
    I will praise him in the midst of the throng.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he stands at the right hand of the needy,
    to save them from those who would condemn them to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord says to my lord,
    “Sit at my right hand
until I make your enemies your footstool.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord sends out from Zion
    your mighty scepter.
    Rule in the midst of your foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your people will offer themselves willingly
    on the day you lead your forces
    on the holy mountains.
From the womb of the morning,
    like dew, your youth will come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind,
    “You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is at your right hand;
    he will shatter kings on the day of his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will execute judgment among the nations,
    filling them with corpses;
he will shatter heads
    over the wide earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will drink from the stream by the path;
    therefore he will lift up his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord!
I will give thanks to the Lord with my whole heart,
    in the company of the upright, in the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great are the works of the Lord,
    studied by all who delight in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Full of honor and majesty is his work,
    and his righteousness endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has gained renown by his wonderful deeds;
    the Lord is gracious and merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He provides food for those who fear him;
    he is ever mindful of his covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has shown his people the power of his works,
    in giving them the heritage of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The works of his hands are faithful and just;
    all his precepts are trustworthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are established forever and ever,
    to be performed with faithfulness and uprightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord!
    Happy are those who fear the Lord,
    who greatly delight in his commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their descendants will be mighty in the land;
    the generation of the upright will be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth and riches are in their houses,
    and their righteousness endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They rise in the darkness as a light for the upright;
    they are gracious, merciful, and righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is well with those who deal generously and lend,
    who conduct their affairs with justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the righteous will never be moved;
    they will be remembered forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are not afraid of evil tidings;
    their hearts are firm, secure in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their hearts are steady; they will not be afraid;
    in the end they will look in triumph on their foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the name of the Lord
    from this time on and forevermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the rising of the sun to its setting,
    the name of the Lord is to be praised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is high above all nations
    and his glory above the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is like the Lord our God,
    who is seated on high,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who looks far down
    on the heavens and the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He raises the poor from the dust
    and lifts the needy from the ash heap,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to make them sit with princes,
    with the princes of his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gives the barren woman a home,
    making her the joyous mother of children.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Israel went out from Egypt,
    the house of Jacob from a people of strange language,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judah became God’s sanctuary,
    Israel his dominion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sea looked and fled;
    Jordan turned back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains skipped like rams,
    the hills like lambs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why is it, O sea, that you flee?
    O Jordan, that you turn back?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O mountains, that you skip like rams?
    O hills, like lambs?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,
    at the presence of the God of Jacob,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who turns the rock into a pool of water,
    the flint into a spring of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Not to us, O Lord, not to us, but to your name give glory,
    for the sake of your steadfast love and your faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should the nations say,
    “Where is their God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our God is in the heavens;
    he does whatever he pleases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their idols are silver and gold,
    the work of human hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have mouths, but they do not speak;
    they have eyes, but they do not see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have ears, but they do not hear;
    they have noses, but they do not smell.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Those who make them are like them;
    so are all who trust in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, trust in the Lord!
    He is their help and their shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O house of Aaron, trust in the Lord!
    He is their help and their shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord!
    He is their help and their shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
he will bless those who fear the Lord,
    both small and great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord give you increase,
    both you and your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May you be blessed by the Lord,
    who made heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens are the Lord’s heavens,
    but the earth he has given to human beings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The dead do not praise the Lord,
    nor do any who go down into silence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But we will bless the Lord
    from this time on and forevermore.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I love the Lord because he has heard
    my voice and my supplications.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because he inclined his ear to me,
    therefore I will call on him as long as I live.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then I called on the name of the Lord,
    “O Lord, I pray, save my life!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gracious is the Lord and righteous;
    our God is merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord protects the simple;
    when I was brought low, he saved me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return, O my soul, to your rest,
    for the Lord has dealt bountifully with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have delivered my soul from death,
    my eyes from tears,
    my feet from stumbling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I walk before the Lord
    in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I kept my faith, even when I said,
    “I am greatly afflicted”;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said in my consternation,
    “Everyone is a liar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What shall I return to the Lord
    for all his bounty to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will lift up the cup of salvation
    and call on the name of the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will pay my vows to the Lord
    in the presence of all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Precious in the sight of the Lord
    is the death of his faithful ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will offer to you a thanksgiving sacrifice
    and call on the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will pay my vows to the Lord
    in the presence of all his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in the courts of the house of the Lord,
    in your midst, O Jerusalem.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord, all you nations!
    Extol him, all you peoples!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is his steadfast love toward us,
    and the faithfulness of the Lord endures forever.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;
    his steadfast love endures forever!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Israel say,
    “His steadfast love endures forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the house of Aaron say,
    “His steadfast love endures forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those who fear the Lord say,
    “His steadfast love endures forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of my distress I called on the Lord;
    the Lord answered me and set me in a broad place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With the Lord on my side I do not fear.
    What can mortals do to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is on my side to help me;
    I shall look in triumph on those who hate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
    than to put confidence in mortals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
    than to put confidence in princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All nations surrounded me;
    in the name of the Lord I cut them off!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They surrounded me, surrounded me on every side;
    in the name of the Lord I cut them off!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I was pushed hard, so that I was falling,
    but the Lord helped me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is my strength and my might;
    he has become my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are glad songs of victory in the tents of the righteous:
“The right hand of the Lord does valiantly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the right hand of the Lord is exalted;
    the right hand of the Lord does valiantly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I shall not die, but I shall live
    and recount the deeds of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has punished me severely,
    but he did not give me over to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open to me the gates of righteousness,
    that I may enter through them
    and give thanks to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the gate of the Lord;
    the righteous shall enter through it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I thank you that you have answered me
    and have become my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The stone that the builders rejected
    has become the chief cornerstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the Lord’s doing;
    it is marvelous in our eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the day that the Lord has made;
    let us rejoice and be glad in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save us, we beseech you, O Lord!
    O Lord, we beseech you, give us success!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord.
    We bless you from the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is God,
    and he has given us light.
Bind the festal procession with branches,
    up to the horns of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are my God, and I will give thanks to you;
    you are my God; I will extol you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
    for his steadfast love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are those whose way is blameless,
    who walk in the law of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are those who keep his decrees,
    who seek him with their whole heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who also do no wrong
    but walk in his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have commanded your precepts
    to be kept diligently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O that my ways may be steadfast
    in keeping your statutes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I shall not be put to shame,
    having my eyes fixed on all your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise you with an upright heart,
    when I learn your righteous ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will observe your statutes;
    do not utterly forsake me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can young people keep their way pure?
    By guarding it according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With my whole heart I seek you;
    do not let me stray from your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I treasure your word in my heart,
    so that I may not sin against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are you, O Lord;
    teach me your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With my lips I declare
    all the ordinances of your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I delight in the way of your decrees
    as much as in all riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will meditate on your precepts
    and fix my eyes on your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will delight in your statutes;
    I will not forget your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deal bountifully with your servant,
    so that I may live and observe your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open my eyes, so that I may behold
    wondrous things out of your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I live as an alien in the land;
    do not hide your commandments from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul is consumed with longing
    for your ordinances at all times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You rebuke the insolent, accursed ones,
    who wander from your commandments;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
take away from me their scorn and contempt,
    for I have kept your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even though princes sit plotting against me,
    your servant will meditate on your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your decrees are my delight;
    they are my counselors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul clings to the dust;
    revive me according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I told of my ways, you answered me;
    teach me your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make me understand the way of your precepts,
    and I will meditate on your wondrous works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul melts away for sorrow;
    strengthen me according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put false ways far from me,
    and graciously teach me your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have chosen the way of faithfulness;
    I set your ordinances before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cling to your decrees, O Lord;
    let me not be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I run the way of your commandments,
    for you enlarge my understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me, O Lord, the way of your statutes,
    and I will observe it to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give me understanding, that I may keep your law
    and observe it with my whole heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lead me in the path of your commandments,
    for I delight in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn my heart to your decrees
    and not to selfish gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn my eyes from looking at vanities;
    be gracious to me according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Confirm to your servant your promise,
    which is for those who fear you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn away the disgrace that I dread,
    for your ordinances are good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See, I have longed for your precepts;
    in your righteousness be gracious to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your steadfast love come to me, O Lord,
    your salvation according to your promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I shall have an answer for those who taunt me,
    for I trust in your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not take the word of truth utterly out of my mouth,
    for my hope is in your ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will keep your law continually,
    forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I shall walk at liberty,
    for I have sought your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also speak of your decrees before kings
    and shall not be put to shame;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I find my delight in your commandments
    because I love them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I revere your commandments, which I love,
    and I will meditate on your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember your word to your servant,
    in which you have made me hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is my comfort in my distress,
    that your promise gives me life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrogant utterly deride me,
    but I do not turn away from your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I think of your ordinances from of old,
    I take comfort, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hot indignation seizes me because of the wicked,
    those who forsake your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your statutes have been my songs
    wherever I make my home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I remember your name in the night, O Lord,
    and keep your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This blessing has fallen to me,
    for I have kept your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is my portion;
    I promise to keep your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I implore your favor with all my heart;
    be gracious to me according to your promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I think of your ways,
    I turn my feet to your decrees;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hurry and do not delay
    to keep your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though the cords of the wicked ensnare me,
    I do not forget your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At midnight I rise to praise you,
    because of your righteous ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am a companion of all who fear you,
    of those who keep your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth, O Lord, is full of your steadfast love;
    teach me your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have dealt well with your servant,
    O Lord, according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me good judgment and knowledge,
    for I believe in your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before I was humbled I went astray,
    but now I keep your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are good and do good;
    teach me your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrogant smear me with lies,
    but with my whole heart I keep your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their hearts are thick like fat,
    but I delight in your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good for me that I was humbled,
    so that I might learn your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The law of your mouth is better to me
    than thousands of gold and silver pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your hands have made and fashioned me;
    give me understanding that I may learn your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who fear you shall see me and rejoice,
    because I have hoped in your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know, O Lord, that your judgments are right
    and that in faithfulness you have humbled me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your steadfast love become my comfort
    according to your promise to your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your mercy come to me, that I may live,
    for your law is my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let those who fear you turn to me,
    so that they may know your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my heart be blameless in your statutes,
    so that I may not be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul languishes for your salvation;
    I hope in your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes fail with watching for your promise;
    I ask, “When will you comfort me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke,
    yet I have not forgotten your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long must your servant endure?
    When will you judge those who persecute me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrogant have dug pitfalls for me;
    they flout your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your commandments are enduring;
    I am persecuted without cause; help me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have almost made an end of me on earth,
    but I have not forsaken your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In your steadfast love spare my life,
    so that I may keep the decrees of your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord exists forever;
    your word is firmly fixed in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your faithfulness endures to all generations;
    you have established the earth, and it stands fast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By your appointment they stand today,
    for all things are your servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If your law had not been my delight,
    I would have perished in my misery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will never forget your precepts,
    for by them you have given me life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am yours; save me,
    for I have sought your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked lie in wait to destroy me,
    but I consider your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen a limit to all perfection,
    but your commandment is exceedingly broad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, how I love your law!
    It is my meditation all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your commandment makes me wiser than my enemies,
    for it is always with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have more understanding than all my teachers,
    for your decrees are my meditation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I understand more than the aged,
    for I keep your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hold back my feet from every evil way,
    in order to keep your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I do not turn away from your ordinances,
    for you have taught me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How sweet are your words to my taste,
    sweeter than honey to my mouth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through your precepts I get understanding;
    therefore I hate every false way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your word is a lamp to my feet
    and a light to my path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have sworn an oath and confirmed it,
    to observe your righteous ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am severely afflicted;
    give me life, O Lord, according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Accept my offerings of praise, O Lord,
    and teach me your ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hold my life in my hand continually,
    but I do not forget your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked have laid a snare for me,
    but I do not stray from your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your decrees are my heritage forever;
    they are the joy of my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I incline my heart to perform your statutes
    forever, to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate the double-minded,
    but I love your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are my hiding place and my shield;
    I hope in your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go away from me, you evildoers,
    that I may keep the commandments of my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uphold me according to your promise, that I may live,
    and let me not be put to shame in my hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hold me up, that I may be safe
    and have regard for your statutes continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You spurn all who go astray from your statutes,
    for their cunning is in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the wicked of the earth I count as dross;
    therefore I love your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My flesh trembles for fear of you,
    and I am afraid of your judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have done what is just and right;
    do not leave me to my oppressors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Guarantee your servant’s well-being;
    do not let the godless oppress me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes fail from watching for your salvation
    and for the fulfillment of your righteous promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deal with your servant according to your steadfast love,
    and teach me your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am your servant; give me understanding,
    so that I may know your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is time for the Lord to act,
