    for your law has been broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly I love your commandments
    more than gold, more than fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly I direct my steps by all your precepts;
    I hate every false way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your decrees are wonderful;
    therefore my soul keeps them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The unfolding of your words gives light;
    it imparts understanding to the simple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With open mouth I pant,
    because I long for your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn to me and be gracious to me,
    as is your custom toward those who love your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep my steps steady according to your promise,
    and never let iniquity have dominion over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Redeem me from human oppression,
    that I may keep your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make your face shine upon your servant,
    and teach me your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes shed streams of tears
    because your law is not kept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are righteous, O Lord,
    and your judgments are right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have appointed your decrees in righteousness
    and in all faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My zeal consumes me
    because my foes forget your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your promise is well tried,
    and your servant loves it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am small and despised,
    yet I do not forget your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
    and your law is the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trouble and anguish have come upon me,
    but your commandments are my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your decrees are righteous forever;
    give me understanding that I may live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With my whole heart I cry; answer me, O Lord.
    I will keep your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cry to you; save me,
    that I may observe your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I rise before dawn and cry for help;
    I put my hope in your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes are awake before each watch of the night,
    that I may meditate on your promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In your steadfast love hear my voice;
    O Lord, in your justice preserve my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who persecute me with evil purpose draw near;
    they are far from your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you are near, O Lord,
    and all your commandments are true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Long ago I learned from your decrees
    that you have established them forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look on my misery and rescue me,
    for I do not forget your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plead my cause and redeem me;
    give me life according to your promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Salvation is far from the wicked,
    for they do not seek your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great is your mercy, O Lord;
    be gracious to me according to your justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are my persecutors and my adversaries,
    yet I do not swerve from your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I look at the faithless with disgust
    because they do not keep your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consider how I love your precepts;
    be gracious to me according to your steadfast love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sum of your word is truth,
    and every one of your righteous ordinances endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Princes persecute me without cause,
    but my heart stands in awe of your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I rejoice at your word
    like one who finds great spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate and abhor falsehood,
    but I love your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seven times a day I praise you
    for your righteous ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great peace have those who love your law;
    nothing can make them stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hope for your salvation, O Lord,
    and I fulfill your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul keeps your decrees;
    I love them exceedingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I keep your precepts and decrees,
    for all my ways are before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my cry come before you, O Lord;
    give me understanding according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my supplication come before you;
    deliver me according to your promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My lips will pour forth praise,
    because you teach me your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My tongue will sing of your promise,
    for all your commandments are right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your hand be ready to help me,
    for I have chosen your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I long for your salvation, O Lord,
    and your law is my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me live that I may praise you,
    and let your ordinances help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek out your servant,
    for I do not forget your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In my distress I cry to the Lord,
    that he may answer me:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
What shall be given to you?
    And what more shall be done to you,
    you deceitful tongue?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A warrior’s sharp arrows,
    with glowing coals of the broom tree!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe is me, that I am an alien in Meshech,
    that I must live among the tents of Kedar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Too long have I had my dwelling
    among those who hate peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am for peace,
    but when I speak,
    they are for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lift up my eyes to the hills—
    from where will my help come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My help comes from the Lord,
    who made heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not let your foot be moved;
    he who keeps you will not slumber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who keeps Israel
    will neither slumber nor sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is your keeper;
    the Lord is your shade at your right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun shall not strike you by day
    nor the moon by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will keep you from all evil;
    he will keep your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will keep
    your going out and your coming in
    from this time on and forevermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was glad when they said to me,
    “Let us go to the house of the Lord!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our feet are standing
    within your gates, O Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem—built as a city
    that is bound firmly together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To it the tribes go up,
    the tribes of the Lord,
as was decreed for Israel,
    to give thanks to the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there the thrones for judgment were set up,
    the thrones of the house of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
    “May they prosper who love you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peace be within your walls
    and security within your towers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of my relatives and friends
    I will say, “Peace be within you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of the house of the Lord our God,
    I will seek your good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To you I lift up my eyes,
    O you who are enthroned in the heavens!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the eyes of servants
    look to the hand of their master,
as the eyes of a maid
    to the hand of her mistress,
so our eyes look to the Lord our God,
    until he has mercy upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us,
    for we have had more than enough of contempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our soul has had more than its fill
    of the scorn of those who are at ease,
    of the contempt of the proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If it had not been the Lord who was on our side
    —let Israel now say—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if it had not been the Lord who was on our side,
    when our enemies attacked us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then they would have swallowed us up alive,
    when their anger was kindled against us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then the flood would have swept us away;
    the torrent would have gone over us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then over us would have gone
    the raging waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord,
    who has not given us
    as prey to their teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have escaped like a bird
    from the snare of the hunters;
the snare is broken,
    and we have escaped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our help is in the name of the Lord,
    who made heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion,
    which cannot be moved but abides forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the mountains surround Jerusalem,
    so the Lord surrounds his people
    from this time on and forevermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the scepter of wickedness shall not rest
    on the land allotted to the righteous,
so that the righteous might not stretch out
    their hands to do wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do good, O Lord, to those who are good
    and to those who are upright in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But those who turn aside to their own crooked ways,
    the Lord will lead away with evildoers.
    Peace be upon Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Lord restored the fortunes of Zion,
    we were like those who dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then our mouth was filled with laughter
    and our tongue with shouts of joy;
then it was said among the nations,
    “The Lord has done great things for them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has done great things for us,
    and we rejoiced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore our fortunes, O Lord,
    like the watercourses in the Negeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who sow in tears
    reap with shouts of joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who go out weeping,
    bearing the seed for sowing,
shall come home with shouts of joy,
    carrying their sheaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unless the Lord builds the house,
    those who build it labor in vain.
Unless the Lord guards the city,
    the guard keeps watch in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is in vain that you rise up early
    and go late to rest,
eating the bread of anxious toil,
    for he gives sleep to his beloved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sons are indeed a heritage from the Lord,
    the fruit of the womb a reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like arrows in the hand of a warrior
    are the sons of one’s youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy is the man who has
    his quiver full of them.
He shall not be put to shame
    when he speaks with his enemies in the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy is everyone who fears the Lord,
    who walks in his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall eat the fruit of the labor of your hands;
    you shall be happy, and it shall go well with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wife will be like a fruitful vine
    within your house;
your children will be like olive shoots
    around your table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus shall the man be blessed
    who fears the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord bless you from Zion.
    May you see the prosperity of Jerusalem
    all the days of your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May you see your children’s children.
    Peace be upon Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Often have they attacked me from my youth
    —let Israel now say—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
often have they attacked me from my youth,
    yet they have not prevailed against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The plowers plowed on my back;
    they made their furrows long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is righteous;
    he has cut the cords of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May all who hate Zion
    be put to shame and turned backward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be like the grass on the housetops
    that withers before it grows up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with which reapers do not fill their hands
    or binders of sheaves their arms,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Out of the depths I cry to you, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, hear my voice!
Let your ears be attentive
    to the voice of my supplications!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you, O Lord, should mark iniquities,
    Lord, who could stand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But there is forgiveness with you,
    so that you may be revered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I wait for the Lord; my soul waits,
    and in his word I hope;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my soul waits for the Lord
    more than those who watch for the morning,
    more than those who watch for the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, hope in the Lord!
    For with the Lord there is steadfast love,
    and with him is great power to redeem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is he who will redeem Israel
    from all its iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, hope in the Lord
    from this time on and forevermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, remember in David’s favor
    all the hardships he endured;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
how he swore to the Lord
    and vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will not enter my house
    or get into my bed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not give sleep to my eyes
    or slumber to my eyelids,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until I find a place for the Lord,
    a dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We heard of it in Ephrathah;
    we found it in the fields of Jaar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Let us go to his dwelling place;
    let us worship at his footstool.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O Lord, and go to your resting place,
    you and the ark of your might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your priests be clothed with righteousness,
    and let your faithful shout for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For your servant David’s sake
    do not turn away the face of your anointed one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord swore to David a sure oath
    from which he will not turn back:
“One of the sons of your body
    I will set on your throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If your sons keep my covenant
    and my decrees that I shall teach them,
their sons also, forevermore,
    shall sit on your throne.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord has chosen Zion;
    he has desired it for his habitation:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is my resting place forever;
    here I will reside, for I have desired it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will abundantly bless its provisions;
    I will satisfy its poor with bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Its priests I will clothe with salvation,
    and its faithful will shout for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There I will cause a horn to sprout up for David;
    I have prepared a lamp for my anointed one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His enemies I will clothe with disgrace,
    but on him, his crown will gleam.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How very good and pleasant it is
    when kindred live together in unity!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is like the precious oil on the head,
    running down upon the beard,
on the beard of Aaron,
    running down over the collar of his robes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is like the dew of Hermon,
    which falls on the mountains of Zion.
For there the Lord ordained his blessing,
    life forevermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, bless the Lord, all you servants of the Lord,
    who stand by night in the house of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up your hands to the holy place,
    and bless the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord, maker of heaven and earth,
    bless you from Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
you who stand in the house of the Lord,
    in the courts of the house of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good;
    sing to his name, for he is gracious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord has chosen Jacob for himself,
    Israel as his own possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I know that the Lord is great;
    our Lord is above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whatever the Lord pleases he does,
    in heaven and on earth,
    in the seas and all deeps.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He it was who struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
    both humans and animals;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he sent signs and wonders
    into your midst, O Egypt,
    against Pharaoh and all his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He struck down many nations
    and killed mighty kings—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
    and Og, king of Bashan,
    and all the kingdoms of Canaan—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and gave their land as a heritage,
    a heritage to his people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your name, O Lord, endures forever,
    your renown, O Lord, throughout all ages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will vindicate his people
    and have compassion on his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The idols of the nations are silver and gold,
    the work of human hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have mouths, but they do not speak;
    they have eyes, but they do not see;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they have ears, but they do not hear,
    a nose, but there is no breath in their mouths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who make them
    and all who trust them
    shall become like them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O house of Israel, bless the Lord!
    O house of Aaron, bless the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O house of Levi, bless the Lord!
    You who fear the Lord, bless the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord from Zion,
    he who resides in Jerusalem.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
    for his steadfast love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O give thanks to the God of gods,
    for his steadfast love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O give thanks to the Lord of lords,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who alone does great wonders,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who by understanding made the heavens,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who spread out the earth on the waters,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who made the great lights,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the sun to rule over the day,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the moon and stars to rule over the night,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who struck Egypt through their firstborn,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and brought Israel out from among them,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with a strong hand and an outstretched arm,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who divided the Red Sea in two,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and made Israel pass through the midst of it,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
who struck down great kings,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and killed famous kings,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and Og, king of Bashan,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and gave their land as a heritage,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a heritage to his servant Israel,
    for his steadfast love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is he who remembered us in our low estate,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and rescued us from our foes,
    for his steadfast love endures forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who gives food to all flesh,
    for his steadfast love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O give thanks to the God of heaven,
    for his steadfast love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the rivers of Babylon—
    there we sat down, and there we wept
    when we remembered Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the willows there
    we hung up our harps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there our captors
    asked us for songs,
and our tormentors asked for mirth, saying,
    “Sing us one of the songs of Zion!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How could we sing the Lord’s song
    in a foreign land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
    let my right hand wither!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth,
    if I do not remember you,
if I do not set Jerusalem
    above my highest joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, O Lord, against the Edomites
    the day of Jerusalem’s fall,
how they said, “Tear it down! Tear it down!
    Down to its foundations!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O daughter Babylon, you devastator!
    Happy shall they be who pay you back
    what you have done to us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy shall they be who take your little ones
    and dash them against the rock!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I give you thanks, O Lord, with my whole heart;
    before the gods I sing your praise;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I bow down toward your holy temple
    and give thanks to your name for your steadfast love and your faithfulness,
    for you have exalted your name and your word
    above everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the day I called, you answered me;
    you increased my strength of soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the kings of the earth shall praise you, O Lord,
    for they have heard the words of your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall sing of the ways of the Lord,
    for great is the glory of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For though the Lord is high, he regards the lowly,
    but the haughty he perceives from far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I walk in the midst of trouble,
    you preserve me against the wrath of my enemies;
you stretch out your hand,
    and your right hand delivers me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, you have searched me and known me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You know when I sit down and when I rise up;
    you discern my thoughts from far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You search out my path and my lying down
    and are acquainted with all my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even before a word is on my tongue,
    O Lord, you know it completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You hem me in, behind and before,
    and lay your hand upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Such knowledge is too wonderful for me;
    it is so high that I cannot attain it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where can I go from your spirit?
    Or where can I flee from your presence?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I ascend to heaven, you are there;
    if I make my bed in Sheol, you are there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I take the wings of the morning
    and settle at the farthest limits of the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
even there your hand shall lead me,
    and your right hand shall hold me fast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I say, “Surely the darkness shall cover me,
    and night wraps itself around me,”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For it was you who formed my inward parts;
    you knit me together in my mother’s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My frame was not hidden from you,
when I was being made in secret,
    intricately woven in the depths of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your eyes beheld my unformed substance.
In your book were written
    all the days that were formed for me,
    when none of them as yet existed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How weighty to me are your thoughts, O God!
    How vast is the sum of them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I try to count them—they are more than the sand;
    I come to the end—I am still with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O that you would kill the wicked, O God,
    and that the bloodthirsty would depart from me—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
those who speak of you maliciously
    and lift themselves up against you for evil!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do I not hate those who hate you, O Lord?
    And do I not loathe those who rise up against you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate them with perfect hatred;
    I count them my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Search me, O God, and know my heart;
    test me and know my thoughts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See if there is any wicked way in me,
    and lead me in the way everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me, O Lord, from evildoers;
    protect me from those who are violent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who plan evil things in their minds
    and stir up wars continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They make their tongue sharp as a snake’s,
    and under their lips is the venom of vipers. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The arrogant have hidden a trap for me,
    and with cords they have spread a net,
    along the road they have set snares for me. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I say to the Lord, “You are my God;
    give ear, O Lord, to the voice of my supplications.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, my Lord, my strong deliverer,
    you have covered my head in the day of battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not grant, O Lord, the desires of the wicked;
    do not further their evil plot. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who surround me lift up their heads;
    let the mischief of their lips overwhelm them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let burning coals fall on them!
    Let them be flung into pits, no more to rise!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let the slanderer be established in the land;
    let evil speedily hunt down the violent!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know that the Lord maintains the cause of the needy
    and executes justice for the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely the righteous shall give thanks to your name;
    the upright shall live in your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call upon you, O Lord; come quickly to me;
    give ear to my voice when I call to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my prayer be counted as incense before you
    and the lifting up of my hands as an evening sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Set a guard over my mouth, O Lord;
    keep watch over the door of my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not turn my heart to any evil,
    to busy myself with wicked deeds
in company with those who work iniquity;
    do not let me eat of their delicacies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the righteous strike me;
    let the faithful correct me.
Never let the oil of the wicked anoint my head,
    for my prayer is continually against their wicked deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they are given over to those who shall condemn them,
    then they shall learn that my words were pleasant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a rock that one breaks apart and shatters on the land,
    so shall their bones be strewn at the mouth of Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But my eyes are turned toward you, O God, my Lord;
    in you I seek refuge; do not leave me defenseless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep me from the trap that they have laid for me
    and from the snares of evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the wicked fall into their own nets,
    while I alone escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With my voice I cry to the Lord;
    with my voice I make supplication to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I pour out my complaint before him;
    I tell my trouble before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When my spirit is faint,
    you know my way.
In the path where I walk,
    they have hidden a trap for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to my cry,
    for I am brought very low.
Save me from my persecutors,
    for they are too strong for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bring me out of prison,
    so that I may give thanks to your name.
The righteous will surround me,
    for you will deal bountifully with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not enter into judgment with your servant,
    for no one living is righteous before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the enemy has pursued me,
    crushing my life to the ground,
    making me sit in darkness like those long dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore my spirit faints within me;
    my heart within me is appalled.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I stretch out my hands to you;
    my soul thirsts for you like a parched land. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer me quickly, O Lord;
    my spirit fails.
Do not hide your face from me,
    or I shall be like those who go down to the Pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me hear of your steadfast love in the morning,
    for in you I put my trust.
Teach me the way I should go,
    for to you I lift up my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save me, O Lord, from my enemies;
    I have fled to you for refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me to do your will,
    for you are my God.
Let your good spirit lead me
    on a level path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For your name’s sake, O Lord, preserve my life.
    In your righteousness bring me out of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In your steadfast love cut off my enemies,
    and destroy all my adversaries,
    for I am your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord, my rock,
    who trains my hands for war and my fingers for battle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my rock and my fortress,
    my stronghold and my deliverer,
my shield, in whom I take refuge,
    who subdues the peoples under me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, what are humans that you regard them,
    or mortals that you think of them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are like a breath;
    their days are like a passing shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bow your heavens, O Lord, and come down;
    touch the mountains so that they smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make the lightning flash and scatter them;
    send out your arrows and rout them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
whose mouths speak lies
    and whose right hands are false.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing a new song to you, O God;
    upon a ten-stringed harp I will play to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the one who gives victory to kings,
    who rescues his servant David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue me from the cruel sword,
    and deliver me from the hand of aliens,
whose mouths speak lies,
    and whose right hands are false.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May our sons in their youth
    be like plants full grown,
our daughters like corner pillars,
    cut for the building of a palace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May our barns be filled
    with produce of every kind;
may our sheep increase by thousands,
    by tens of thousands in our fields,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and may our cattle be heavy with young.
May there be no breach in the walls, no exile,
    and no cry of distress in our streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are the people to whom such blessings fall;
    happy are the people whose God is the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will extol you, my God and King,
    and bless your name forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every day I will bless you
    and praise your name forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great is the Lord and greatly to be praised;
    his greatness is unsearchable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One generation shall extol your works to another
    and shall declare your mighty acts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will recount the glorious splendor of your majesty,
    and on your wondrous works I will meditate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will proclaim the might of your awesome deeds,
    and I will declare your greatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall celebrate the fame of your abundant goodness
    and shall sing aloud of your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is gracious and merciful,
    slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is good to all,
    and his compassion is over all that he has made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your works shall give thanks to you, O Lord,
    and all your faithful shall bless you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall speak of the glory of your kingdom
    and tell of your power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to make known to all people your mighty deeds
    and the glorious splendor of your kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
    and your dominion endures throughout all generations.
The Lord is faithful in all his words
    and gracious in all his deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord upholds all who are falling
    and raises up all who are bowed down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of all look to you,
    and you give them their food in due season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You open your hand,
    satisfying the desire of every living thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is just in all his ways
    and kind in all his doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is near to all who call on him,
    to all who call on him in truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He fulfills the desire of all who fear him;
    he also hears their cry and saves them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord watches over all who love him,
    but all the wicked he will destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth will speak the praise of the Lord,
    and all flesh will bless his holy name forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord!
Praise the Lord, O my soul!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise the Lord as long as I live;
    I will sing praises to my God all my life long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not put your trust in princes,
    in mortals, in whom there is no help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When their breath departs, they return to the earth;
    on that very day their plans perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are those whose help is the God of Jacob,
    whose hope is in the Lord their God,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will reign forever,
    your God, O Zion, for all generations.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord!
How good it is to sing praises to our God,
    for he is gracious, and a song of praise is fitting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord builds up Jerusalem;
    he gathers the outcasts of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He heals the brokenhearted
    and binds up their wounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He determines the number of the stars;
    he gives to all of them their names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great is our Lord and abundant in power;
    his understanding is beyond measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord lifts up the downtrodden;
    he casts the wicked to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord with thanksgiving;
    make melody to our God on the lyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He covers the heavens with clouds,
    prepares rain for the earth,
    makes grass grow on the hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gives to the animals their food
    and to the young ravens when they cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His delight is not in the strength of the horse
    nor his pleasure in the speed of a runner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but the Lord takes pleasure in those who fear him,
    in those who hope in his steadfast love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Extol the Lord, O Jerusalem!
    Praise your God, O Zion!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he strengthens the bars of your gates;
    he blesses your children within you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He grants peace within your borders;
    he fills you with the finest of wheat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sends out his command to the earth;
    his word runs swiftly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gives snow like wool;
    he scatters frost like ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hurls down hail like crumbs—
    who can stand before his cold?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sends out his word and melts them;
    he makes his wind blow, and the waters flow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He declares his word to Jacob,
    his statutes and ordinances to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him, all his angels;
    praise him, all his host!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him, sun and moon;
    praise him, all you shining stars!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him, you highest heavens
    and you waters above the heavens!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them praise the name of the Lord,
    for he commanded and they were created.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He established them forever and ever;
    he fixed their bounds, which cannot be passed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord from the earth,
    you sea monsters and all deeps,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
fire and hail, snow and frost,
    stormy wind fulfilling his command!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mountains and all hills,
    fruit trees and all cedars!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wild animals and all cattle,
    creeping things and flying birds!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kings of the earth and all peoples,
    princes and all rulers of the earth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Young men and women alike,
    old and young together!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He has raised up a horn for his people,
    praise for all his faithful,
    for the people of Israel who are close to him.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord!
Sing to the Lord a new song,
    his praise in the assembly of the faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Israel be glad in its Maker;
    let the children of Zion rejoice in their King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them praise his name with dancing,
    making melody to him with tambourine and lyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord takes pleasure in his people;
    he adorns the humble with victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the faithful exult in glory;
    let them sing for joy on their couches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the high praises of God be in their throats
    and two-edged swords in their hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to execute vengeance on the nations
    and punishment on the peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to bind their kings with fetters
    and their nobles with chains of iron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to execute on them the judgment decreed.
    This is glory for all his faithful ones.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him for his mighty deeds;
    praise him according to his surpassing greatness!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him with trumpet sound;
    praise him with lute and harp!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him with tambourine and dance;
    praise him with strings and pipe!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him with clanging cymbals;
    praise him with loud clashing cymbals!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let everything that breathes praise the Lord!
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator
